She has been at this trade for the past 5-years and it requires a lot of sacrifice and much effort. Usually, Edith works all day to earn enough to take care of her baby because as she grows she has more needs.

She enjoys this job of selling clothes as it is a profitable business, though the only drawback seems to be in the shipment of these goods. Edith desires a different life for her baby Araceli, where she’ll have the best opportunities to forge a better future. With the funding from this loan request, she will purchase more merchandise and try to increase her sales. In the future, she would like to have a small clothing store to showcase her collection in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase a clothing nventory for sales.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 10 años dedicada a la elaboración de velas negocio que aprendió de sus padres ya que ellos le enseñaron este conocimiento. ella tiene 3 pequeños hijos y es su deseo poder brindarles educación mejor calidad de vida. la elaboración de velas le deja ingresos mayores a los que tendría si trabaja en una empresa, además le permite estar siempre con sus hijos, con el auge que ha tenido su producto, ahora también renta las velas para eventos y después del evento recoge sus adornos y vuelve a reutilizables, así también recolecta los envases de cristal de las velas que se consumen en la iglesia del pueblo y ella los reutiliza para sus arreglos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz has dedicated herself to making candles for 10 years, a business that she learned from her parents as they taught her this skill. She has 3 young kids and her desire is to be able to bring them a better quality education. Making candles gives her a better income than she would have if she was working in an office, and it also allows her to be with her kids. With the growth that her product has had she can now also rent out her candles for events, and after the event she collects her ornaments and reuses them. She also gets the glass candle holders that they use at the town's church and reuses them for her arrangements.

She needs a loan of $200, which she will repay over a period of 3 months, to buy material and to be able to continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work material/comprar material de trabajo

loans.name: Annabel

texts.es:
Annabel es una persona muy sociable, responsable y trabajadora. Inició su negocio ya que quiso probar algo diferente y como siempre le han gustado mucho las ventas ya que tiene una la oportunidad de conocer más personas, pensó que era un reto interesante y por eso inicio su negocio. Comenzó el mes de Mayo de 2006, cuando una amiga la invitó a una demostración en su casa y fue ahí donde se inicio con la venta de cosméticos, invirtiendo una pequeña suma de productos al principio, los cuales fue vendiendo a sus amigas y vecinas. Ha ido cumpliendo con las metas que se había propuesto y puede decir que no se arrepiento de haber iniciado este negocio ya que le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientas y seguir dándoles un buen servicio que le permita retenerlas y para que al mismo tiempo la recomienden con otras personas.
texts.en:
Annabel is a hard-working, responsible, and very sociable person. She initiated her business because she wanted to try something different and as usual she enjoyed sales very much since she has an opportunity to get to know more people. She thought that it was an interesting challenge and therefore she started her business. She began in the month of May 2006, when a friend invited her to a demonstration in her house. It was there where she started the sale of cosmetics, investing in a small quantity of products at the beginning, which she sold to her friends and neighbors. She has been complying with the goals that had been proposed and she can say that she is not sorry that she started this business since it has gone very well.

She needs a loan of $250 that will be repaid in 4 months, to be able to fulfill the orders of her clients and to continue giving them good service, which will allow her to retain them and so that they will recommend her to other people at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Emma Patricia

texts.es:
Emma inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera progresar económicamente y poder ayudar a su mamá con sus hermanos pequeños. Ella quería contar con un ingreso más de dinero, ya que tuvo que dejar sus estudios de preparatoria para meterse a trabajar y ayudar a su mamá ya que necesitaba mucho el dinero porqué su padre los abandonó y había muchas necesidades en casa. Comenzó en el mes de Septiembre de 2007, vendiendo tortas con su mamá por las noches enfrente de su casa, ya que con una “tanda” de dinero que recibió y con la ayuda de un crédito que le otorgaron pudieron comprar un carrito de tortas para poder ayudarnos y salir adelante, pues ella deseo estudiar una carrera universitaria y seguir ayudando a su mamá y a sus hermanos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de tacos y tortas y unas sillas de plástico en donde la gente pueda sentarse a comer para darles un mejor servicio y mayor comodidad
texts.en:
Emma started the business to obtain an extra income which would allow her to progress economically and to be able to help her Mum out with her younger siblings. She wanted be able to count on another income as she had to leave her studies to start working and help her Mum as she needed the money a lot as her father left them and they had a lot of need at home. She started in September 2007 selling cakes with her Mum by night outside their house, and with a 'batch' of money that she got and with the help of a credit that she was given she was able to buy a cart to sell cakes to be able to move forward. She wishes to study a university degree and to keep helping her mother and siblings.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, to buy ingredients to make tacos and cakes and some plastic chairs where people can sit down to eat so they can give their clients a better service and more comfort.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients/comprar materia prima

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda inició el negocio después de que se divorcié tuvo la necesidad de meterse a trabajar para poder ayudarse, pero el salario era muy bajo por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio. Comenzó en el mes de Marzo de 2003, cuando una amiga la convenció para que se dedicara al transporte escolar, ya que se dio cuenta que llevaba a algunos hijos de mis vecinos, le dio la idea de que hablara con sus mamás para llevarlos todos los días y que le pagaran semanal o quincenalmente. Siguió su consejo y en la actualidad transporta a 37 niños y gracias a las recomendaciones de las maestras, cada año tiene una lista de niños que transporta y le ha ido muy bien y gracias esto he podido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar unas refacciones y afinar su camioneta, además que necesita rotularla, todo esto para brindar un servicio cómodo y seguro para sus pequeños clientes.
texts.en:
Yolanda started the business after she got divorced as she needed to work to help herself, but the salary was very low. For this reason she decided to start her own business. She started her business in March 2003 when a friend convinced her to start a school transport service, as she realized that she took some of her neighbors kids to school and this gave her the idea of talking to some of the mums about taking their kids to school each day and they could pay her weekly or fortnightly. She followed this advice and now takes 37 kids to school thanks to recommendations from teachers, and each year she has a list of kids to take to school and it has gone very well for her and thanks to this she has moved forward.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, to buy spare parts and to tune up her bus, and she also needs to put a sign on it. All of this is to bring a more comfortable and safer service for her young clients.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tune up her bus/comprar refacciones y afinar su camioneta

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 23 años, vive con su esposo Máximo y sus tres hijos; Gilmer de 19 años, Yolanda de 15 y Yeny de 13. Se dedica a atender su negocio de juegos, Mini Billar, en una plaza de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace ya 10 años. El no concluir sus estudios primarios hizo que Teodora no pueda aspirar a estudiar una carrera universitaria, y dedicarse íntegramente al trabajo desde muy joven, en variedad de oficios, como el de atender mini billares de otras personas, hasta que hace dos años juntó el dinero suficiente para comprar una mesa de billar, con la cual trabaja en la actualidad. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que ella solo controla el tiempo de alquiler de la mesa y cobra por su uso, siendo lo más difícil quedarse atendiendo hasta muy tarde y el frío que hace por esas horas, quedándose a veces hasta las 8 de la noche. Teodora quiere ofrecerle a su familia mejores oportunidades, como darles una buena educación, para que sean en un futuro profesionales de éxito. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar otra mesa y hacer crecer su negocio.  En el futuro quiere expandirse, poniendo un billar, alquilando un local para hacer de este un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Teodora is 23-years old and lives with her husband, Maximo, and their three children. Gilmer is 19, Yolanda is 15 and Yeny is 13-years old. For the past 10-years, she has dedicated herself to servicing the gaming business known as mini billiards, located in the city plaza of Juliaca. Not having completed school in her younger years, Teodora could not aspire to studying in college and thus has devoted herself entirely to working in a variety of trades to services other mini billiard people.

It took 2-years to earn enough money to purchase the billiards table that she uses now. She likes that she alone controls the rental times for the table and charges for its use. Though she feels it’s difficult to provide service in the evenings when it gets late and colder, sometimes going on as late as 8 PM into the evening.

Teodara wants to offer her family better opportunities, to give her daughter a good education to be a successfully professional in the future. With the funding from this loan, she would like to buy more billiard tables and grow her business. In the future, she would like to expand the billiard business and possibly rent rooms to make the business more stable.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an additional billiard table to earn more rental profit.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.es: Noeme tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo Adolfo de 35, el cual se dedica a trabajar en su motocarro, y con sus hijos; Ester de 14 años y Juan José de 5. Desde hace 8 años, se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, actividad que realiza desde las 11 de la mañana hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche, en la plaza dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca.  Es una mujer trabajadora, en busca de un mejor bienestar para su familia, dedica varias horas a su trabajo, el cual es muy cansado, por la cantidad de clientela que frecuenta su negocio, siendo esto al mismo tiempo muy bueno, ya que puede generar más ingresos a la economía familiar. Noeme quiere ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, para que hagan sus sueños realidad.  Con el dinero que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platos y complacer a su clientela que día a día se hace más grande; y en el futuro poner un pequeño restaurante, el cual pueda administrar desde su casa.
texts.en:
Noeme is 34 years old and lives with her 35 year old husband, Adolfo, and her children: Ester who is 14 years old and Juan Jose who is 5 years old. Adolfo makes a living by using his car. For the past 8 years, Noeme has sold food on the streets, working from 11:00 in the morning to 7:00 or 8:00 at night in the main plaza in the city Juliaca. She is a working woman in search of a better life for her family. She dedicates many hours to work, which is very tiring due to the quantity of clients that visit her business; at the same time, this is good because she can generate more income for her family. Noeme would like to offer her children a better future so that they can make their dreams a reality. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes and please her clientele that increases each day. In the future, she would like to have a small restaurant that she could run out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro inició el negocio por necesidades económicas, ya que requería contar con recursos para solventar los gastos de su familia y crearse un patrimonio, así como una forma de subsistir económicamente. Comenzó hace 5 años vendiendo materiales escolares poco a poco fue agregando otros objetos todos ellos de uso escolar así como servicio de copiadora, hasta que logro establecer su papelería.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ramiro began his business because of economic needs since he required resources to settle family expenses and create a savings account. He began five years ago selling school materials and little by little adding other objects for school use like copying services and now he has succeeded in establishing his own stationary shop. He needs a loan for $475, which he will pay back in six months, to buy merchandise and be able to make his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 46 años, está divorciad, vive con sus dos hijos; Ronald de 11 y María de 6 años.  Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y al alquiler del único triciclo que posee, desde hace 4 años, después de la separación con su pareja tuvo que trabajar en todo lo posible para lograr más ingresos económicos para su familia.  Juana se dedica todo el día a vender sus golosinas de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca, y para el alquiler de su triciclo no necesita mucho tiempo, ya que las personas que lo quieren van directamente hasta su casa para solicitarlo, trata de trabajar en todo lo posible para poder mantener a su familia, siempre ha trabajado y le gusta lo que hace, pero no deja de ser agotador, dice.  El motivo de su esfuerzo, es sacar adelante a su familia para que no carezcan de nada. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de golosinas, para aumentar su venta y en el futuro invertir en otro negocio mucho más rentable.
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old, divorced, and lives with her two children: Ronald, 11 years old, and Maria, 6 years old. She makes a living by selling candies and by renting out a tri-cycle that she owns. For the past 4 years, after she separated from her husband, she has had to work in every way possible in order to make enough income to support her family. Today, Juana makes a living by selling candies on the street in the city of Juliaca and by renting the tricycle, which does not require much time since the people who want it go directly to her house. She tries to work as much as she can in order to support her family. She has always worked and likes doing it, but she says it leaves her exhausted. Her motive is to move forward with her family so that they do not lack anything. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more candies to increase her sales and in the future, invest in a more profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of candies she sells

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo Hugo de 43 años, el cual es triciclista y sus dos hijos; Soledad de 18 y Anisa de 13. Se dedica a la atención de su mini billar, el cual es muy frecuentado por los jóvenes de la ciudad de Juliaca, negocio que atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche, dependiendo de la clientela que a veces suele quedarse mucho más tarde, haciendo que Margarita tenga que esperar a que terminen su juego y retirándose a altas horas de la noche, luchando con el imperante frío de la ciudad. Por otra parte, la tranquilidad de su trabajo hace que éste le guste, ya que no tiene que hacer ningún tipo de esfuerzo físico, que su edad y su salud no se lo permiten.  Margarita quiere que su familia sea feliz y que la preocupación económica no sea un problema para sus deseos personales. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere refaccionar su mesa de billar, la cual está un poco desgastada. En el futuro, quiere tener muchas más mesas y un local fijo para la atención de su billar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old, lives with her 43 year old husband Hugo, a cyclist, and her two children: Soledad, 18 years old, and Anisa, 13 years old. She makes a living by offering small billiards games, visited by many young people in the city of Juliaca. Her business is open from 8 in the morning to 7 or 8 at night, depending on the clientele that sometimes stays late, making Margarita hope for the games to end so she can go to bed in the late hours of the night, while fighting the prevailing coldness of the city. On the other hand, the ease of her job is why she likes it: she does not have to make any physical effort that her age and health would not permit her. Margarita’s personal wishes are for her family to be happy and for economic worries to not be a problem. With the money from the loan, she would like to remodel the billiards table, which is a little worn out. In the future, she wants to have a lot of tables and a location that specializes in billiards.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel her billiards table that she rents for games

loans.name: Laura Esthela

texts.es:
Laura inicio el negocio para contar con recursos para solventar los gastos de sus estudios ya que ella estudia en la Escuela Normal Superior, donde se prepara para ser maestra y su mama no podía pagar todos los gastos de colegiaturas y materiales que a diario utiliza, por lo que hace 2 años puso un snack y dos computadoras para que sus mismos compañeros las utilizaran con una mínima cuota y a la ves consumieran sodas y comida rápida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 4 meses para poner más variedad en sus productos y obtener más ganancias y continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Laura began her business to gain financial resources for settling her school expenses since she is studying in the "Escuela Normal Superior", where she is preparing to be a teacher; her mother could not pay all the expenses of tuition and materials used daily. This is why two years ago she opened up a snack bar with two computers that her peers could use for a minimum price while they drank sodas and ate snack food at the same time. She needs a loan for $325, which she will pay back in four months, to add a greater variety of products and obtain greater earnings to continue with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio tiene 39 años, vive con su pareja Gladis de 37 años y su hija Sintia de 15.  La familia de Epifanio se mantiene gracias a su trabajo de triciclista, actividad que viene realizando hace 10 años, pudiendo obtener su propio triciclo hace dos años, actividad en la cual viene trabajando incansablemente para mantener a su familia, en compañía de su esposa, la cual se dedica al comercio. Empieza una jornada diaria usualmente desde las 7 de la mañana, hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche para recaudar los ingresos suficientes, siendo lo más difícil, el esfuerzo físico que demanda manejar un triciclo, pero para Julián, sin esfuerzo no hay recompensa, es así que le pone mucho empeño en realizar su trabajo, gustándole mucho. Epifanio quiere que su familia no sufra incomodidades, es así que  quiere ofrecerles lo mejor, para que tengan mejores oportunidades futuras. Con el dinero solicitado arreglará algunos imperfectos de su triciclo y comprará mayor mercadería para que su esposa comercialice, y así juntar capital para poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Epifanio is 39 years old, lives with his 37 year old wife, Gladis, and his 15 year old daughter, Sintia. Epifanio’s family is supported by his work as a cyclist, an activity that he has been doing for the past 10 years. Having obtained his own tricycle 2 years ago, he has worked tirelessly to support his family along with his wife who works in sales. He starts his daily routine around 7:00 in the morning and works until 7:00 or 8:00 at night in order to earn enough income. The most difficult part is the physical effort that his job demands, but there is no reward without effort and this is why he strives to do his job with pleasure. Epifanio does not want his family to suffer discomforts and wants to offer them the best so they have a future of better opportunities. With the requested funds, he will fix the flaws of his tricycle and will buy merchandise at wholesale for his wife to sell. With this capital, they can establish a small grocery store in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix flaws of tri-cycle and purchase merchandise for his wife to sell

loans.name: Livia

texts.es: Livia tiene 35 años, convive con Antonio, su pareja de 36 años, y con sus hijos; Jhon de 9, Yurema de 4 y Dony de 2.  El alquiler de triciclos es el negocio de Livia, se ha estado dedicando a ello desde hace 3 años para mantener a su familia, y poder brindarles comida y educación.  La ventaja del trabajo es que los triciclos se encuentran en su casa, trabajar desde ahí, pudiendo pasar mayor tiempo con sus hijos, que es lo que más le gusta; pero no todo es color de rosa, ya que algunas veces, los triciclos alquilados regresan raspados o con algún tipo de avería, a  pesar de todos los inconvenientes Livia sigue adelante con muchas ganas de prosperar. Ella quiere que su familia tenga mejores oportunidades de progresar, gracias a su negocio. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere reparar algunas averías de los triciclos, para que trabajen de mejor manera.  En el futuro, Livia quiere expandir su negocio y alquilar muchos triciclos más.
texts.en:
Livia is 35 years old and lives with her 36 year old husband, Antonio, and her children: Jhon, 9 years old, Yurema, 4 years old, and Dony, 2 years old. She rents tricycles as her business and has been doing this for the past 3 years to support her family and to provide food and education. The advantage of her job is that she can run the business from her home while spending time with her children, the part she likes the best. However, it is not always so rosy. Sometimes the rented tricycles are returned scratched or broken in some way. Despite the inconveniences, Livia continues to progress with the intent to succeed. She would like her family to have better opportunities to advance from her business. With the funds from this loan, she would like to repair the broken tricycles so that they work better. In the future, Livia would like to expand her business and rent more tricycles.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair broken tricycles that she rents for transport of local travelers

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es: Celedonio tiene 29 años, es soltero, vive en casa de su familia. Es un joven emprendedor, trabaja en su mocarro para ganarse la vida, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana transita por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, velozmente llevando a los pasajeros que requieren de sus servicios hasta sus destinos. Al no tener esposa, ni hijos, se dedica íntegramente a su trabajo, distrayéndose con él, para espantar su soledad. Celedonio quiere tener una familia y necesita estabilidad económica para poder ofrecerles una buena calidad de vida, es por eso que trabaja arduamente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para su motocarro, y así mejorar el servicio que brinda.  Le gustaría  ampliar su negocio comprando muchos más motocarros, así obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Celedonio is 29 years old, single, and lives in his family’s home. He is a young entrepreneur, working with his motocar to earn a living. From very early in the morning, he travels the Juliaca city streets quickly taking passengers that require his services to their destinations. Having no wife or children, he dedicates himself entirely to his work keeping himself distracted by it to chase away his loneliness. Celedonio wants to have a family and needs a stable economic standing to be able to offer them a good quality of life. This is why he works arduously. With the money he is soliciting, he will buy replacement parts for his vehicle so that he can improve the service that he offers. He would like to broaden his business by buying more motocars so that he can obtain greater income.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for his motocar, which he uses for local transport of passengers.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive de forma independiente en un cuarto que alquilo. Se dedica a brindar servicio de Mototaxi por las principales calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, para poder mantenerse económicamente, ya que dado que vive solo, vela por sus gastos de alimentación y vivienda.  Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 años, cuando pudo adquirir mediante mucho esfuerzo su motocarro, desde entonces le ha puesto muchas ganas para sacarle el máximo provecho, trabajando diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta llegada la noche.  Lo que le gusta a Julio es el dinamismo de su trabajo, tener que trasladar a las personas a diferentes lugares hace que su trabajo no sea rutinario.  Lo difícil es tener que lidiar con algunos caminos en mal estado, o los que son un poco peligrosos en horas de la noche. Viene esforzándose así, para labrarse un mejor porvenir. Con el dinero que Julio solicita arreglará su motocarro, para brindar un mejor servicio a la población. En el futuro, quiere tener una empresa de mototaxis, contratando a personal que así como él, quiera iniciarse en este oficio.
texts.en:
Julio is 28 years old, single, and lives on his own in a rented room. He makes a living by offering taxi services in the main streets of the city Juliaca in order to support himself economically. Because he lives alone, he is responsible for his living and food expenses. Julio started this occupation 6 years ago when he was able to purchase a taxi car. Since then, he has put much effort into maximizing the benefits, working daily from 8:00 in the morning until dusk. Julio likes the dynamics of his job, having a cross section of people from different places and not conforming to a set routine. The difficulty is fighting the streets in poor condition, or those that are very dangerous at night. He is trying now to build a better future for himself. With the money that Julio is requesting, he will fix his taxi so that he can offer a better service to the public. In the future, he would like to have his own business of taxis, hiring people that are like him, who would want to establish themselves in this occupation.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his taxi, with which he provides transport to the public

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es: Eddy tiene 28 años y un hijo de 6 años, su  esposo dice que es muy responsable, la ha apoyado para que tenga su negocio de carnicería. Se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para ir a comprar carne en una zona alta, las 8 ya está de regreso, otros días, alternados, va a comprar pescado al por mayor, en cambió, el pollo, le abastecen a su puesto. Luego de la compra se dedican a vender, de acuerdo las exigencias del cliente, ya sea pescado, carne o pollo. Le gusta mucho estar en contacto con la gente, por ello que en las tardes se dedica a vender tamales, gaseosas o frutas.  Su esposo trabaja en Gabiones, es una especie de defensa en el río, con piedras. Su anhelo es remodelara su puesto con material noble (cemento), apropiado para su negocio. Eddy no toma su labor como un trabajo, porque se divierte mucho con sus clientes, por ello se esfuerza en tener surtida su carnicería con todas las variedades de carne, por ende mejorar y ampliar su puesto, para dar un buen servicio al público. Con el dinero del préstamo, invertirá en javas de pescados, asimismo en la compra de carnes rojas, y sobre todo, para reparar su congeladora que tiene fallas en la conservación de la carne. Cree que con el tiempo, va a ir mejorando.
texts.en:
Eddy is 28 years old and has one son that is 6 years of age. Her husband states that she is very responsible, and has supported her so that she could have her butcher business. She rises at 5 a.m. in the morning to go to purchase meat, and she returns by 8 a.m. Every other day, she goes to purchase fish at wholesale and, alternatively, the poultry is supplied to her location. After the buying, she dedicates herself to selling in accordance with the customers’ demands, be it fish, beef or poultry. She likes very much being in contact with people, which is why in the afternoons she dedicates herself to selling tamales, sodas or fruit. Her husband works in gabiones (anchored stone dams) which help protect river beds. Her dream is to remodel her post with better materials (cement) appropriated for her business. Eddy doesn’t view her labor as work because she enjoys her time with customers so much, which is why she puts forth great effort to have her butcher’s shop well-stocked with a variety of types of meat. She wants to improve and expand her location, so she can provide good service to the public. She will invest the funds from the loan into the purchase of fish, red meat and, most importantly, into the repair of her freezer which she needs to preserve her products. She thinks that, with time, things will improve for her.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of all types of meats, as well as to repair freezer.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty cuenta con 23 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus 2 hijos y con su esposo que es agricultor. Ella ha crecido en el ambiente del cultivo, proviene de padres agricultores, y se ha casado con un responsable agricultor. Después de cocinar el almuerzo que lleva a la chacra, apoya en las labores agrícolas a su esposo, han sembrado de 4 sacos de semilla y esperan cosechar un aproximado de 50 sacos, también está sembrando maíz y habas, estos sembríos necesitan de abono, porque sino, dice,  no producen como para ser vendidos en el mercado. Asimismo se dedica a la venta de carne roja de ovino. El problema para ellos es el incremento de los abonos.  Betty y su esposo trabajan a veces junto y a veces cada quien en sus actividades, con el afán de comprar una casa propia, ya que quiere su privacidad, nos dice. Con el préstamo, comprará abonos y guano para sus cultivos de habas y maíz, con la finalidad de que produzcan bien y puedan cotizarlos un buen precio.
texts.en:
Betty is 23 years old and lives in her parents’ house with her two children and husband, who is a farmer. She was raised in a farming environment – her parents are farmers – and she married a responsible farmer. After cooking the breakfast which she takes to the farm, she supports her husband in his agricultural labors. They have planted four sacks of seed, and hope to sow approximately 50 sacks. She is also planting corn and beans. These crops require fertilizer because if not, she says, they will not produce enough to be sold at the market. At the same time, she dedicates herself to the sale of red meat from sheep. The problem for them is the high price of fertilizers. Betty and her husband work together sometimes, and at times each alone with their own activities. They yearn to purchase their own home, as she tells us, she would like her privacy. With the loan, she will buy fertilizers and manure for the bean and rice crops hoping that, in the end, they will have a good harvest and be able to sell their products for favorable prices.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her bean and corn crops.

loans.name: Hedy

texts.es: Hedy, a sus 23 años ha quedado viuda, con una niña de 8 meses, ahora está viviendo con su madre, que le apoya en este negocio del restaurante. Años atrás se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero dejó porque hay temporadas donde no es rentable, desde entonces, abastece de comida a los transeúntes del puente llamando Paucartambo. Trabaja en sociedad con su madre, para de ese modo puedan aliviarse el trabajo de todo el día desde; el desayuno, almuerzo y cena, se tiene que levantar a las 4 de la mañana y dormir a las 11 de la noche, por lo que terminan el día, muy cansadas.  Una de las mayores dificultades es el alza en el precio del pollo, ya que no pueden elevar el precio del menú, porque no tendría clientes y se quedarían con la comida preparada, por ello, se limitan a preparar de 10 a 20 platos, ganando casi, el 50% de su inversión.  Al quedarse sola, tiene que trabajar para la alimentación y vestimenta de su hija, y para ofrecerle un futuro próspero, cuando tenga necesidades de educación. Tiene en mente, invertir en la compra de vidrios para sus mesas, asimismo comprar un par de mesas, para darles comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hedy is a 23 year old widow with an 8 month old daughter. She is living with her mother who helps her with her business, a restaurant. She used to be a farmer but she gave it up because the seasons were not profitable enough. Since then, she has prepared food for people traveling over the Paucartambo bridge. Her mother helps her with the daily duties which include making breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They wake up at 4:00 a.m., go to bed at 11:00 p.m. and are very tired when their day ends. One of the biggest difficulties is the rise in cost of chicken because if they raised the menu prices, they would have no customers and would be left with the extra meals. Consequently, they only prepare 10 to 20 plates per day, earning back 50% of their investment. As a single woman, Hedy has to work in order to provide food and clothing to her daughter, and to offer her a prosperous future that includes the necessities for an education. With this loan, she thinks she will invest in glasses and new tables to provide more comfort for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables for her restaurant in order to improve its atmosphere

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel cuenta con 22 años, tiene dos hijos, su esposo es cerrajero. Isabel vive en la casa de su madre, lo que trabaja su esposo no les alcanza para que puedan adquirir terreno y hacer su casa. Se dedica ha atender a sus dos hijos menores de edad y preparar los alimentos de la familia; a veces por las tardes se dedica a lavar ropa ajena, los fines de semana prepara caldo de gallina y los ricos tamales que ofrece de casa en casa, aunque no le paguen al momento y después en el lapso de la semana, realiza sus cobranzas.  Desde niña ha crecido en el ambiente del comercio, porque su madre de ese modo los crió.  Ella ama el prepara los fines de semana sus potajes, pero antes primero tiene que asegurarse cuántos platos preparará para que no le sobre. Lo que le incomoda mucho es cuando demoran en pagar sus clientes y siente que no ve lo que gana. Al tener su propia familia, su mayor anhelo es tener su casa propia, es por ello que ha emprendido del mundo del negocio, y junto a sus esposo aúnan fuerzas para comprar su terreno. Este dinero le servirá como capital para que realice sus ventas de fin de semana, ya no solo 10 platos, sino de 30 a 40 platos por semana, más adelante quiere poner una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Isabel is 22 years old, has two children and her husband is a locksmith. Isabel lives in her mother's home because what her husband makes is not enough to allow them to have their own land and to build a house. She works taking care of her two young children and preparing food for the family. Sometimes in the afternoons she works washing clothes for people. On the weekends she prepares chicken soup and delicious tamales that she sells door to door. They don't pay her right away so during the week she works to collect the money.

Since she was a little girl, she has grown up around business because her mother raised her that way. She loves to make stews on the weekends but first she has to be sure about how many servings she will prepare so that there's no food left over. What is very uncomfortable for her is when her clients take a while to pay her as she feels that she's not seeing what she's earning.

Having her own family, her greatest dream is to have her own house. It's for this reason that she has entered the business world and together with her husband will purchase their land. This money will serve as business capital so that she can make her weekend sales. Not just 10 servings but 30 to 40 per week. Later on she wants to have a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients needed to prepare food to sell on the weekends

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es: Noelia es una joven soltera muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de su madre, en sus horas libres ayuda en casa y en el negocio de comida que realiza su madre. Desde hace 11 meses trabaja en un restaurante cerca al barrio donde vive, trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 2 de la tarde, luego apoya a su mamá.  Anteriormente tenía la idea de estudiar corte y confección; pero con el trabajo en este restaurante, ha cambiado su modo de pensar;  ahora quiere tener su propio restaurante, porque ha aprendido el manejo de ello, sobre todo porque le fascina el mundo de la gastronomía  y estar en contacto con la gente, esto le va a permitir emplear a su madre, que también conoce de ese negocio. Lo malo es que no cuenta con los recursos para iniciar este negocio, debido a que conoce el funcionamiento considera que en el futuro le iría muy bien. El motivo de su esfuerzo es apoyar a su madre, y sobre todo tiene ambiciones de crecer y ser una empresaria. Noelia, ahora que tiene la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo, inmediatamente va emplearlo para realizar una actividad de venta de pollada o parrillada, de ese modo hará crecer su dinero, y después empezar la venta de comida en su casa con la ayuda de su madre, y poco a poco llegar a tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Noelia is a young, single woman who is a very hard worker. She lives at home with her mother. In her spare time she helps around the house and also with her mother's food business. For the past 11 months, she has worked in a restaurant near the neighborhood where they live. She works from 6:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon and then helps her mother. Before, she had the idea to study dressmaking but because of her work at the restaurant, she has changed her way of thinking. Now she wants to have her own restaurant because she has learned how to manage one, but mainly because she is fascinated by the world of gastronomy and being in contact with people. This is going to allow her to employ her mother who also knows that business. The bad thing is that she doesn't have the resources to start the business. Since she knows how it functions, she thinks that things will go will for herself in the future. The motive behind her determination is to support her mother and above all, she has the ambition to grow and to be a businesswoman. Noelia now has the opportunity to receive a loan. Right away she is going to use the money to sell chicken and grilled foods. That way she will make her money grow and, after food sales from home with the help of her mother, little by little she will get to the point of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to start a business selling food from home

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 38 años, ella y su esposo siempre han trabajado en diversas actividades para mantener a sus ocho hijos que están en la edad escolar.   Cada día, después de dejar la comida preparada en su casa, sale a trabajar, ahora se dedica a lavar ropa a mano para diferentes personas, le pagan 3 soles por 12 prendas, su esposo a veces trabaja de albañil, o de lo contrario se va la caza de animales del campo, típicos de la zona, como el cutpe o sajino, estos animales María los vende a los restaurantes, y de es modo luchan juntos por el sostenimiento de su familia. A ella no le gusta lavar ropa, porque suele enfermar por el esfuerzo que conlleva esta labor, por ello tiene en mente dedicarse a la compra y venta de ropa por las zonas de cultivos.  María es una madre abnegada, y muy sacrificada, todos los trabajos que realiza son para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Acceder al préstamo, es para ella una bendición, porque le dará la oportunidad de comprar ropa y convertirse en negociante, considera que le va ir muy bien en sus ventas.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old. She and her husband have worked various jobs to support their eight school aged children. Each day, after leaving the food prepared at home, she leaves for work. Right now she washes clothes by hand for different people. They pay her three soles for 12 pieces. Sometimes her husband works as a day laborer, or if not, he hunts animals in the country - animals typical for that region like cutpe or wild pigs. María sells the animals to restaurants and in that way they work together to sustain their family. She doesn't like washing clothes because she is prone to illness due to the intense work involved. She has in mind buying and selling clothing in the rural areas. María is an unselfish mother and very dedicated. All of the work that she does is to feed and educate her children. To receive this loan is a blessing for her because it will give her the opportunity to purchase clothing and turn herself into a businesswoman. She believes that she will do well in sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adquirir prendas de vestir para dedicarse a la venta de estas.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio tiene 43 años, felizmente casado, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales, el mayor trabaja en Lima. Su esposa es  cosmetóloga, cuando puede le ayuda en la venta de gaseosas  y helados.  De profesión chofer, Lucio tiene plantíos de plátano de diversas variedades, 2 hectáreas, pero nos dice que este tiempo no es buena temporada. Recién a partir de enero y febrero se internaré en sus plantaciones, en esas fechas tendrá un precio razonable las frutas, por eso ahora trabaja haciendo taxi, a partir de las 5 de la tarde, durante toda la noche, con un carro alquilado, que a diario paga 30 soles. Descansa hasta las 10 de la mañana, luego se levanta para trabajar en la venta de gaseosas y helados, su mayor anhelo, es tener una bodega bien surtida, porque en su zona no las hay. Por ello ha empezado a vender gaseosas y cervezas, para poco a poco ir comprando más, para tener un negocio rentable, y sus hijos no pasen necesidades y sean bueno profesionales. Con el dinero que está solicitando, va comprar varias cajas de cerveza, asimismo variedades de gaseosas, y mas adelante piensa ampliar la construcción de su casa para implementar la bodega, considera que tendrá una buena clientela, ya que tiene amistad con todos sus vecinos del barrio.
texts.en:
Lucio is 43 years old, happily married and has four children. The oldest works in Lima. His wife is a cosmetologist and when she can, she helps him sell soft drinks and ice cream. A chauffeur by trade, Lucio has two hectares of plantings of diverse kinds of bananas but tells us that right now is not a good season. Starting in January and February he will move to the banana plantation and at that time will earn a reasonable price for the fruit but for now he is driving a taxi starting at 5:00 in the afternoon and working all night. He has a rented car and each day earns 30 soles. He sleeps until 10:00 in the morning and then gets up and goes to work selling soft drinks and ice cream. His greatest dream is to have a well stocked store because there isn't one in the area where he lives. That's why he has started selling selling soft drinks and beer so that little by little he can begin to purchase more in order to have a more profitable business. He wants his children's needs met and for them to become professionals. With the money that he is requesting, he is going to buy several cases of beer and a variety of soft drinks. In the future he plans to add on to his house to have room for the store. He believes he will have a good clientele because he is friends with all of his neighbors in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incrementar la cantidad de gaseosas y cervezas que vende.

loans.name: Linna

texts.en:
Linna C. is 21 years old, and she is a grocery seller. In fact, she has been in this line of business since 2006, earning approximately US$2.50 per day. Moreover, she is married to Mr. Mei Phanna, 26, a farmer who grows rice (he is pictured). Linna has one daughter, who is small and young.

To generate another source of income, she is seeking a loan in the amount of US$800 to purchase piglets to breed for resale. Importantly, any remaining loan proceeds would be used to purchase chairs for her grocery-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed for resale and to purchase chairs for her grocery-selling business

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat K. is a 54-year-old widow who breeds pigs and grows fruit trees on her farmland for a living. She has three children, two of whom are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh, while her third child lives with her at home and attends school.

Her business is doing very well, but she wants to expand the business to generate even more income. Accordingly, she is seeking a loan in the amount of US$600 to purchase more piglets to breed, and any remaining loan proceeds would be used to purchase insecticide and fertilizer in order to protect her fruits.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more piglets to breed as well as insecticide and fertilizer to protect her fruits

loans.name: Ien

texts.en: Ien M., 69, is a widow who sells groceries from her house. She has been selling groceries since 2004 and currently can earn around $3 USD per day. She lives with two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter stays home to help her sell groceries and her son is a motorcycle taxi driver. To grow her business and to increase her income, she needs a loan of $500 USD  to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. She hopes the loan will enable her to expand her groceries to fulfill her customers' requirements.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan N. is a 44-year-old widow who sells vegetables in her area market for a living. Indeed, she has been selling vegetables at the market since 2005, and she generally earns approximately US$4 per day. She has four children, all of whom live at home with her in Rokar Khpurs Commune, Kandal Province. Moreover, she notes that three of her children are bricklayers, and that they each generate approximately US$75 of income per month.

Nan needs a loan in the amount of US$700 to purchase a trailer to use in conjunction with her motorcycle to transport vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to use in conjunction with her motorcycle in order to transport vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeng N. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Ta Saom Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Yuos Koy, is a construction worker. In his business, he now faces a problem because his workplace is too far from their house and he spends a lot of money on transportation. Thus, Mrs. Soeng N. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to go to work.

Mrs. Soeng N. has five children, one of whom is a monk while three others are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is five years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Channoeurn's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group loan and there are three members. Channoeurn P. is group leader and is a garment worker in Chak Angre Krom Commune in the Phnom Penh City. She can earn US$120 per month. Channoeurn is married to Mr. Pov Khim, 33, also a garment worker, and they have one child. For another source of income, Channoeurn needs a loan of US$150 to repair her house to rent and she sees that the majority of her clients are garment workers. The loan will allow her to increase her family's income. The other two group members are:

1- Touch C., who grows vegetables to sell and she needs a loan of US$250 to purchase more seeds to grow vegetables.

2- Phalla P., who is a widowed garment worker and needs a loan of US$150 to add to her saved money to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to drive to her work.

They are all people who live in Prek Talong Village, Chak Angre Krom Commune, Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To decorate her house to rent

loans.name: Yuos

texts.en:
Mrs. Yuos S. is a villager in Ta Saom Village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy three more pigs for breeding. She would use any remainder of the money to purchase more pig food to feed her pigs.

Her husband, Mr. Khoem Pich, is a construction worker who can make only a meager income to support his family. Mrs. Yuos S. is 35 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is five years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy three more pigs for breeding

loans.name: Shamim Badar Din's Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is the wife of B. D. and lives in an area named Riwind, Paksitan. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son sells clothes. The middle sone drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her youngest son and her daughter work in a cotton factory. Shamim baji herself has a thread-making business. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her son’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Shamim baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy more mobile phones for her mobile phone shop. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy carpets and rugs to resell at a market. Azra baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehcile).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda S. is 23 years old and is a farmer, growing rice. She can earn around US$2 per day. Chenda is married to Mr. Kuy Phanny, 25, who is also a farmer, and they have two small children who stay at home. For another source of income, she needs a loan of US$300 to purchase a machine to make sugarcane juice to sell at the primary school in her village. She lives in Taream Village, Chrey Vean Commune, Kampong Cham Province.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to make sugarcane juice to sell

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat S. is a 52-year-old widow who farms (she grows rice) for a living. Yat has five children, two of whom are married, while the other three children live at the family's home. Further, two children are goldsmiths, and one of the other children is a car driver for a private company. The income generated by her children generally supports the family's living expenses.

Even so, for another source of income, Yat is seeking a loan in the amount of US$500 to purchase rice and soy-beans to sell for profit. In this way, she believes that the requested loan will enable her to increase her family's income and standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice and soy-beans to resell for profit

loans.name: Nop

texts.en: Mrs. Nop L. is a farmer in Kraing Bonteay Village in Takeo Province. Nop is 55 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is attending the local school and the last one stays at home to do housework. Her husband, Mr. Toem Rith, helps her in their plantation. Aside from this, he is also a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Nop would like to purchase five more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hem P. was born in 1962 and she now lives in Pour Dos Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Men Sie, are farmers. They have six children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. Two others are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four.

Although Mrs. Hem P.'s family members have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Hem P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cows. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan S. is a villager in Damnak Rovieng Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hang Toeurn, are farmers. They live in poor conditions because they have only one business to earn their living. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Phan S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. Mrs. Phan S. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Phut

texts.en:
Mr. Phut P. is 31 years old, and he makes charcoal to sell and fishes in his area for a living. He has been operating his business since 2006, and he typically earns approximately US$8 per day. In addition, he is married to Mrs. Vorn Nak, who is a 29-year-old farmer. Phut has two children, both of whom are young and attend school.

To generate additional income, Phut is seeking a loan in the amount of US$1,000 to purchase three oxen to use in connection with his charcoal-selling business; more specifically, the oxen would be utilized to transport charcoal to customer's homes. Moreover, a portion of the loan proceeds would be used to grow rice and for his fishing operation.

loans.use: To purchase three oxen to transport charcoal to customer's homes

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin S. is a farmer in Damnak Rovieng Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Hang Tun, helps in the plantation. Their family lives in poor conditions because they have only one business to provide for their living. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow.

Mrs. Sin S. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young at the age of two years. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mr. Chin S. was born in 1972 and he now lives in Klaong Thvear Village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who can make a little revenue to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Pen Sokhom, sells palm sugar. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more palm sugar to meet her customers' demand.

Mr. Chin S. has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the other three attend the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study at the age of seven months. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more palm sugar.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong S. is a villager in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who now faces a small problem, because her field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Suong S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Hin Pros, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support his family. Mrs. Suong S. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study at the age of four years. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Aem

texts.en:
Mrs. Aem M. is a villager in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chheom Sovanney, are farmers. They now face a problem with their plantation, because their field is infertile and has badly affected their crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Aem M. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to make their crop more productive.

Mrs. Aem M. is 47 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the four remaining attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to make their crop more productive.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mrs. Yi C. was born in 1957 and she now lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Yi C. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the field. Her husband, Mr. Chib Kheng, helps his wife on the plantation.

Mrs. Yi C. has three children, one of whom is a teacher while the two remaining ones are pursuing their studies at university. Her husband also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to make the field more fertile

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat I. is a 39-year-old farmer who also sells grocery items from her house. On average, she can earn approximately US$2.50 per day. Socheat is married to Mr. KI. Sokha and they have three children, all of whom are in school: one child is in secondary school and another child is in primary school. Her husband is a silversmith in his area and can earn approximately US$2.50 per day.

To both meet her customer's demands and to generate greater income, Socheat is seeking a loan in the amount of US$800 to expand her grocery inventory by purchasing a wider variety of products to sell. Notably, any remaining loan proceeds would be used to purchase silver for her husband's business.

loans.use: To diversify her product offerings by purchasing additional grocery items and to purchase silver for her husband's business

loans.name: Moeng

texts.en: Mrs. Moeng O. is a farmer in Prey Khla Tboung Village in Takeo Province. In this plantation, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crops. To solve this problem, Mrs. Moeng O. is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer to improve her field to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Un Thol, is a pig breeder. Mrs. Moeng O. is 42 years old and the mother of three children, all enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to make her crops more productive

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuon S. is a villager in Prey Khla Tboung Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and she now cannot grow rice because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Tuon S. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose; she would use any remainder of the loan to purchase more fertilizer and pesticide to make her crop better.

Mrs. Tuon S. is a 53-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field and purchase more fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
Mrs. Phem N. is a villager in Prey Khla Tboung Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who can get a little rice revenue because she owns a small piece of land. In this plantation, she now faces a problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Khoem Yin, helps his wife in the plantation. Mrs. Phem N. is 56 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Andoung Samrith Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer, but she cannot cultivate the rice because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to plow the field. In order to cultivate rice, Mrs. Heng S. decided to ask for a loan, and she will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to support her crop.

Her husband, Mr. Ut Sochon, helps his wife on the plantation. Mrs. Heng S. has four children, one of whom is a car driver while the other two attend the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study at the age of four years. Her husband and daughter are shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the field, and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N. is 36 years old, and she is a farmer. Specifically, she grows rice for a living, but she also makes Khmer traditional baskets to sell from her house. She has been operating her business since 1990, and she currently earns approximately US$2.20 per day. Moreover, she is married and has three children, one of whom is a garment worker who earns approximately US$20 per day. Her husband, a 33-year-old man, breeds pigs and sells the pigs.

To generate more income, Mom is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 Riel (US$375) to purchase bamboo in order to make baskets to sell. In addition, any remaining loan proceeds would be used to buy pig food for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo in order to make baskets to sell and, if there are remaining loan proceeds, to purchase pig food for her husband's business

loans.name: Naseem Abdul Aziz's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the wife of A. A. and lives in an area named Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 16 years. She is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son works in a factory. Her second son is in 10th standard [grade]. The others are free and don't do anything. Naseem baji's husband sells animal food in the market. Naseem baji herself has an ice-selling business. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. Because she could not make the expected profit from her ice-selling business, she plans to start a grocery shop, for which she requires a loan.

Naseem baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Asghari baji wants a loan to buy more fruits to resell. Riaz baji wants a loan to buy more wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina has owned a small restaurant in Zanzibar since 2006.  She runs the restaurant daily from 7:00am to 9:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $85.  She is taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania so that she may buy more food to sell at the restuarant and increase her profit.  Amina is married with children, aged 5, 9, 13, 16 and 18.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: Aisha began selling charcoal in Zanzibar earlier this year.  She works from 8:00am to 10:30pm every day and earns a monthly profit of approximately $60.  She is now taking out her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy a greater inventory of charcoal, so that she can increase her sales.  Aisha is 25 years old, married, and has two children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Ashura.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hamdullah

texts.en: Hamdullah is 30 years old, married, and the father of five children. He lives in Behsood Ningarhar province. Hamdullah has two daughters and three sons, his oldest son is studying in the fifth class in the public school, and the others are small. He has own house and his parents live with him. He used to be an auto driver and now he has a hairdressing shop. To support his family, he needs money so he contacted the lenders of (AFSG) to take a 50000 (AF) loan for 18 months. He wants to buy such items as chairs, tables, and other things. He also wants to hire a person to work for him in his barber shop. He will now be very happy and he thanks the lenders of (AFSG) so much.

loans.use: Hamdullah would like to buy tables, chairs and supplies for his barber shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 23 years old and lives in Beirut, where he is an automotive electrician. Ali has noticed that recently many Lebanese, particularly young people, are opting to install more advanced stereos in their cars, and Ali wishes to capitalize on this trend by purchasing several models for his shop. To fund this significant investment, he has requested a loan of 1000 US Dollars from Al Majmoua. This will be Ali's third loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: The loan will be used to help Ali purchase new stock for his auto electrical repair business

loans.name: Razina's Group

texts.en:
Razina is 31 years old, married, and has four children. Her children are 15, 13, and 6 years old, and her youngest is just 8 months. Razina has been cooking and selling food in Zanzibar for one year. Her two most popular products are sambusa and soup. Sambusa are a common snack food in Tanzania made up of a flaky, fried, triangular outer shell stuffed with either cooked vegetables or meat. The soups she sells often have a tomato- and coconut-based broth and sometimes contain meat. The soups are often served over rice.

Razina works daily from 4:30am to 10:30pm preparing and selling her food. She is currently able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $45. She is hoping that her first loan from BRAC Tanzania enables her to increase her food production and sales.

She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Subira and Zawadi.

loans.use: Razina would like to buy more ingredients for the food she cooks and sells and Subira and Zawadi would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en: Yehya is a 48 year old man and he lives in Beirut with his wife and five children. Yehya owns a taxi and works 16 hours every day in order to support his family. His taxi is suffering from severA. major mechanicA. problems and so he has asked for a loan of $1200 in order to perform maintenance on his vehicle. This is the second time that Yehya has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. His previous loan was repaid in full and on time.

loans.use: Yehya would like to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is 24 years old and married with no children. She has been selling charcoal in Zanzibar since 2007. Charcoal is a staple in households throughout Tanzania as it is still the most common method of food preparation in the country. As a result, there is a large market for charcoal in Zanzibar. Fatma is currently able to earn approximately $25 per month through her charcoal sales but she is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her inventory and expand her business.

loans.use: Fatma would like to buy more charcoal to resell as her business.

loans.name: Phong

texts.en:
Phong R., 44, is married and lives with four of her children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has worked as a local teacher and makes US$1 per day. Her husband, Phong Pom, 41, is a construction worker building houses. He makes on average about US$1 per day as well. This couple also gets support from three of their children who work in a garment factory; their other child is a student.

Phong used to be a farmer but since it provided the family with harder work for less profit she decided to stop and start teaching young children in the state school in the village. Her husband has had a business building house since before they were married and so far he is still doing that job to earn a living. She said currently she faces a financial crisis because she spends more than she is able to make. The price of rice has doubled in the past year and the price of meat and fish has increased 30-60 percent.

To make more money, Phong is asking for a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner. She plans to replace the small grinding mill that she use currently in order to purchase a grinding mill to service the people in the village for extra profit. She also plans to build a bigger house. Her future plan is that she wants her youngest daughter to complete at least high school.

loans.use: Phong would like to replace her small grinding mill.

loans.name: Miza

texts.en: Miza is married and has four children, ages 9, 10, 14, and 16. She has been cooking and selling maandazi in Zanzibar since 2007. Maandazi are a common breakfast or snack food in Tanzania consisting of fried slightly sweet dough.  They are usualy square or triangular and taste similar to a plain donut. Miza's primary hours of business are 7:00am to 10:00am which is when she prepares all of the maandazi that she will sell throughout the day. She currently earns a monthly profit of approximately $45 but she is hoping that taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania will help her to increase this profit.

loans.use: Miza would like to buy more ingredients to prepare and sell maandazi.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 24 years old and lives in Lebanon's capitA. city, Beirut. Hussein owns a beauty salon in his neighborhood and also works in the car trading industry. Hussein has asked for a loan of $1000 US Dollars from A. Majmoua to cover some of his importation expenses.

loans.use: Hussein would like to cover the importation expenses of an automobile to resell.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen H. is a widowed farmer and lives with four of her children in the Prey Veng, Cambodia. She grows various kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make about US$8 each day. She is aided by two of her children who are employed by an organization in the village. Two other children are students. She said on average, she spends around US$45 on food and US$25 on children's education.

Chen H. has requested a loan from Kiva via CREDIT, a local partner, for US$1200 to breed cows for sale. For her future plans, she wants to breed more cows for sale, as well as to produce baby cows. She said she will work hard for her children's education. She also plans to build a new house.

loans.use: To breed cows for sale.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is married and has five children, ages 1, 3.5, 7, 9, and 12. Salma sells firewood and bread in Zanzibar. She works daily from 7:00am to 3:00pm which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $45. She is hoping that her first loan from BRAC Tanzania enables her to increase her profit.

loans.use: Salma would like to buy more firewood and bread to sell.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng C. is 56 years old and a fisherman who has been fishing in Tonlesap Lake since 1985. He is married to Mrs. Van Voeurn whom is a farmer growing rice. He has four children, one of whom is married and the others stay at home. Normally, Pheng always buys rice to stock for a while and resells it at when prices are high. He needs a loan of US$1,000 to purchase rice to stock for resell in a high price period. The loans allow him to increase his family's income. Pheng's wife is pictured because he was not available at the time.

loans.use: Pheng would like to purchase rice to stock to resell when it becomes expensive.

loans.name: Mwanamku

texts.en: Mwanamku is married and has four children, ages 7, 10, 12, and 14, and she has been selling charcoal in Zanzibar since 2002. Charcoal is the most common method of cooking food in Tanzania so there is a large market for this type of fuel. Everything from rice to cakes to fish is cooked over charcoal as stoves and ovens are uncommon. Mwanamku works from 7:00am to 9:00pm daily and earns a profit of approximately $60 each month. She is hoping that her first loan from BRAC Tanzania allows her to increase her inventory, expand her business, and earn her a greater profit.

loans.use: Mwanamku would like to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab T. is 51 years old and lives in Beirut with her husband and two children. She owns a small mini-market which sells oil, cheese, candy, cola, and all sorts of other household necessities. Zainab is a very energetic woman and works in her shop daily from 7:30 am to 10 pm. Zainab wants to buy new products to sell in her mini-market in order to answer all of her clients' needs. She has requested her second loan from Al Majmoua, this time for $1200US, in order to finance her large stock purchase.

loans.use: Zainab would like to purchase new stock for her mini-market.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban N., 48, is married and lives about 124 miles from the capital of Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. Living in the Kampong Cham, she and her husband typically make US$5 each day. She says every day she and her husband walk their bicycle to purchase recycling items from house to house in the village and sell them to the recycling plant. This couple together has seven children, three of who are married and no longer stay at home. Three other children are employed and only one is still a student. Besides their recycling business they also grow rice to earn a living as well, but their farming is just to support their family members.

Ban N. would like to take out a loan through Kiva via CREDIT, a local partner, of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport the recycling items. This will be an easier and faster way to transport the products. The rest of the money will be used to purchase fertilizers for her farm. For her future plans, she wants her children to complete at least high school and if they need to continue, she will strongly support them, even though she knows that she will spend a lot, as she wants them to get better jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and fertilisers.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say N., 40, is a widowed farmer who lives with two of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She typically makes about US$4 each day from growing rice and many kinds of vegetables and is financially aided by two of her children who work in garment factory. Say would like to take out a loan of US$400 to purchase bean seeds and to hire farm workers to plow her farmland.

loans.use: Say would like to purchase bean seeds and hire workers for her farm.

loans.name: Alama

texts.en:
Alama has been selling fish in Zanzibar since 2004. She works daily from 8:30am to 8:30pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $45. She is hoping that her first loan from BRAC Tanzania will help her to expand her business and increase her profit.

Alama is 36 years old, married, and has children aged 4, 6, 8, 16 and 18.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her inventory.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven S., 46, is a true entrepreneur who works selling fish in the village market and earns approximately US$6 each day. Her husband is a horse-cart driver who usually transports the goods from the farm to the market and also drives people, too. This couple together has two children and they both work as construction foremans. Ven would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a bigger horse for her husband's cart.

loans.use: Ven would like to purchase a bigger horse for her husband's cart.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan K., 45, is married and lives with two young children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2001, she has worked together with her husband in a recycling business. Every day, she and her husband walk their bicycle to purchase the items from house to house in the village and then resell them to the big dealer to earn a living. They are able to make US$3 of profit per day.

Chan Khen would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase recycling products in a large amount.

loans.use: To purchase recycling products in a large amount.

loans.name: Mkiaka's Group

texts.en:
Mkiaka sells perfumes at a small shop in Zanzibar. She currently earns approximately $30 each month but she hopes that by taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania she will be able to increase her profit and expand her business.  
Mkiaka is married and has a two-and-a-half year old child. She will be sharing this loan with her group member, Miti.

loans.use: Mkiaka would like to buy more perfumes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pring would like to buy more fish to breed and more medicine for her husband who is a doctor.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata  Konaté est agée de 32 ans et vit avec ses cinq( 5) enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) )
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, elle s’essaya à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès. Elle opta finalement de s’installer dans le secteur de la nourriture depuis maintenant 8 ans.
