Paula se auto educó y aprendió a escribir algunas palabras y a firmar su nombre, porque sus padres nunca la pusieron en una escuela, ya que pensaban que la educación solamente es para los hombres. Se casó con Santos P. Rosales y tuvieron 6 hijos, 3 de los cuales dependen de ella.
Paula trabaja con la compra y venta de leche y también queso que ella misma fabrica, reparte a sus clientes en Motil y Agallpampa. Manifiesta que ha logrado tener mucha autoestima desde que está con Manuela Ramos, ahora sabe que tiene derechos y que como mujer vale mucho.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo utilizó para comprar material para la fabricación de quesos.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar víveres para vender en su casa ya que por su barrio no hay tiendas de víveres.
Paula sueña con viajar y conocer todo el Perú.
texts.en:
Señora Paula is 57 years of age. She is a member of the community bank San Luis and in charge of the popular cafeteria in her country home. She lives in the neighborhood La Laguna del Caserío de Motil, in the district of Agallpampa, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. Paula is self educated and learned to write some words and sign her name, because her parents never put her in school since they thought education was only for the men. She married to Santos P. Rosales and they had six children, three of who depend on her. Paula works in purchasing and selling milk, and also cheese that she makes, and delivering it to her clients in Motil and Agallpampa. She has come to gain a lot of self-esteem since she has been with Manuela Ramos; now she knows that she has rights and that as a woman she is worth a lot. Her first loan was for 300 Soles and was paid back in four months; she used it to buy material for making cheeses. With this loan for 800 Soles, which she will repay in six months, she plans to buy supplies and provisions to sell in her home since her neighborhood doesn't have any such shops. Paula dreams of traveling and getting to know all of Perú.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy provisions to sell in her home.

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es:
Doña Ileana H. tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada, su esposo es guarda de seguridad, tienen una hija de 14 años de edad. Doña Ileana es maestra, imparte clases en un colegio público de Managua, tiene 26 años de dedicarse a la docencia. Ella piensa que su misión es contribuir a la enseñanza y que los niños adquieran nuevas habilidades que puedan ser utilizadas en su futuro.

Doña Ileana está solicitando el crédito para comprar perlines y zinc y cambiar el techo de su vivienda, que actualmente está en muy mal estado.
texts.en:
Ileana H. is 50 years old and lives in the Sandino Memorial neighborhood in Managua. She's married to a security guard, and together they have a 14-year-old daughter. Ileana is a teacher at a public school in her city and has been making a living in the field for 26 years. She thinks that her mission is to contribute to children's education so they can acquire skills to help them in the future. Ileana is requesting the loan to purchase beams and zinc to put a new roof over her home, since the current one is in a very bad state.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a new roof on her home

loans.name: Rocio Edith

texts.es:
La señora Rocio Edith tiene 37 años de edad, es la tesorera del Banco Comunal Hilos de Plata y vive en la Mz G lote 6 Víctor Raúl-Manuel Arévalo, distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y ya no continuó estudiando porque no tenía medios económicos. Tenía su pareja pero se separó y ahora es madre soltera con un hijo de 11 años que depende de ella.
Primero trabajó vendiendo abarrotes, pero no obtenía mucha ganancia, entonces optó por vender fruta en forma ambulatoria en su triciclo y de esto si obtiene buena ganancia, ahora vende fuera del mercado Acomar en Manuel Arévalo.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró fruta.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en fruta e incursionará en la cria de pollos.
Rocio sueña con tener una tienda muy grande donde se venda variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Señora Rocio Edith is 37 years of age. She is the treasurer of the community bank "Hilos de Plata" and lives in Mz G lot 6 Víctor Raúl-Manuel Arévalo, district of Huanchaco, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied completely through secondary school and is not continuing to study anymore because she does not have the economic means. She had a husband but they separated and now she is a single mother with one son who is eleven years old and he depends on her. First she worked selling groceries, but she didn't earn much money. Then she opted to sell fruit in a traveling manner with her tricycle and she earns good money this way. Now she sells outside the market Acomar in Manuel Arévalo. With the first loan of 300 Soles, repaid in four months, she bought fruit. With this loan for 800 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will invest in fruit and branch out by starting to raise chickens. Rocio dreams of having a very big store where she sells a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fruit and begin raising chickens.

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es:
El nombre del cliente es Candida del Rosario M. su edad es de 70 años  su  estado civil es de casada no tiene hijos a  su cargo su compañero de vida tiene un negocio propio, el sueño que ella tiene es poder continuar atendiendo su pequeño cafetín, el cual esta ubicado en la empresa Enitel, donde alquila un pequeño local, de esta manera lograr su auto sostenibilidad, por consiguiente sus ingresos fijos y aporte al hogar.


La señora Candida del Rosario cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo el cual tiene un negocio de servicios telefónicos, la señora M. tiene ocho años de dedicarse a esta actividad ofreciendo todo tipo de refrigerios, golosinas y otros sus mayores deseos es poder establecer un negocio en su casa  y para ello requiere contar con el apoyo nuestro y hacer realidad su proyecto,  la señora M. trabaja con fundación león 2000 desde hace cinco años, manifiesta que agradece a fundación  el apoyo que le han brindado y espera que se le siga apoyando para poder cumplir con su sueño que es lo que tanto desea.
texts.en:
The nameof the client is Candida del Rosaria Montaya and her age is 70 years. Her marital status is married. She doesn't have children in her charge. Her life partner has his own business, the dream that she has is to be able to continue attending her small cafe, which is located in the Enitel area, where she rents a small space, and in this way to attain her self sustainability, to meet her bills. Mrs. Candida del Rosario counts on the help of her husband, who has a telephone services business. Mrs. M. has 8 years dedicated to this activity offering all types of tidbits. Her biggest hope is to be able to establish a business in her home, and for this, she requires our support. to make her project a reality, Mrs. M. has worked with the Leon 2000 Founation for five years, and thanks to the foundation's support, she has achieved and continues to continue the support to complete her dream which is all that she wants so much.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital

loans.name: Rosa Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Candelaria tiene 43 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Hilos de Plata II y vive en Mz C lote 12 Manuel Arévalo tercera etapa de Manuel Arévalo, distrito La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió Primaria completa y no continuó estudiando por motivos económicos. Se casó a los 20 años con el señor Felipe Segura y tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos dependen de ella.
Se inició en su negocio vendiendo mazamorra, salchipollo y anticuchos al paso. Actualmente también vende golosinas que saca a la puerta de su casa en una vitrina, este último se da todo el día, por la tarde vende mazamorra y otros dulces y en la noche vende salchipollo y anticuchos.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró su vitrina.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, el cual será cancelado, en 4 cuotas, comprará panteones, chocolate y luces de bengala para Navidad.
Rosa sueña con tener una tienda grande y bonita.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Candelaria is 43 years old and a member of the community bank "Hilos de Plata II." She lives in Mz C lot 12 Manuel Arévalo third stage of Manuel Arévalo, district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through primary school completely and is not continuing to study due to economic reasons. She married at age 20 to Señor Felipe Segura and has five children, three of whom depend on her. She began her business in selling on foot mazamorra (maize porridge), salchipollo (french fries with fried chicken), and anticuchos (Peruvian kebab). Now she also sells snacks that she keeps in the door of her house in a display case. She does this activity all day, sells mazamorra and other sweets in the evening, and sells salchipollo and anticuchos at night. With her first loan of 300 Soles, which she repaid in four months, she bought her display case. With this loan of 300 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy pants, chocolate, and Bengal lights for Christmas. Rosa dreams of having her own big and beautiful store.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy pants, chocolate, and Bengal lights.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa L. Tandaypan es la presidenta del banco comunal Jerid Camino al Éxito, tiene 48 años de edad y vive en Andrés Tello manzana 1 lote 7 en el pueblo joven Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el quinto año de educación secundaria y ya no continuó porque su madre no podía apoyarla, el papá las había abandonado. Se casó con Segundo Pastor y tiene 6 hijos, pero ahora solamente uno depende de ella. Rosa se separó de su esposo.
Se inicia en el negocio como costurera, pero también confecciona sandalias, polos, etc.
 Manuela Ramos, le dio la oportunidad para comprar su máquina, manifiesta, porque gracias al préstamo pudo completar el monto de inversión.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles, que canceló en 4 meses, compró material para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles, el cual  será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará sandalias al por mayor.
Su sueño es tener un taller  de costura con muchos ayudantes.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa L. Tandaypan is the president of the community bank "Jerid Camino al Éxito." She is 48 years of age and lives in Andrés Tello, block 1, lot 7, in the young town Aurora Díaz, district of Salverry, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the fifth year of secondary education and has not continued because her mother was not able to support her and her father abandoned them. She married to Segundo Pastor and has six children, but now only one son depends on her. Rosa is separated from her husband. She began the business as a seamstress but also makes sandals, polos, etc. Manuela Ramos gave her the opportunity to buy her sewing machine because thanks to the loan from them she was able to complete the amount needed to make that investment. Her first loan was for 300 Soles, which was repaid in four months, and purchased material for her business. With this loan for 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy sandals in bulk. Her dream is to have a sewing shop with many helpers.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sandals in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María tiene 36 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y vive en la calle Antenor Orrego s/n del distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando porque se casó con el señor Carlos Alfaro Guzmán, tiene 2 hijos varones y 2 hijas mujeres aún estudiantes.
Ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de animales mayores, pero ella independientemente se dedica a la costura y a la elaboración de manualidades, también hace quesos y vende leche, pero últimamente no pudo trabajar por encontrarse delicada de salud. Su negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, es cuando se independiza del negocio de su esposo creando otra entrada económica para su hogar, compró cuajada y elaboró quesos, también compró animales menores y algunos materiales para su costura.
Con este préstamo de 100 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará un cerdo a 25 soles y el resto lo gastará en material para manualidades para vender en Navidad.
Su gran sueño es tener su propio capital para no tener deudas pendientes.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa María is 36 years of age and a member of the community bank Mujeres del Mañana ("Women of Tomorrow"). She lives on the street Antenor Orrego of the district of Agallpampa, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through secondary school completely but did not continue studying because she got married to Señor Carlos Alfaro Guzmán. She has two sons and two daughters who are still students. She and her husband together are dedicated to buying and selling animals. She works independently sewing and making craftworks and she also makes cheeses and sells milk, but lately she couldn't work because she found herself in a delicate state of health. Her business is located in her home. With her first loan of 300 Soles, repaid in four months, she made herself independent of her husband's business and created another economic source for their household. She bought curd and made cheeses; she also bought young animals and some materials for sewing. With this loan for 100 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a pig for 25 soles and the rest of it will be spent on material for craftworks to sell during Christmas. Her great dream is to have her own capital so she won't have pending debts anymore.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pig and material for craftworks.

loans.name: Rossy Paola

texts.es:
La señora Rossy Paola pertenece al banco comunal Jerid Camino al Éxito, tiene 27 años de edad y vive en la calle Andrés Tello manzana 1 lote 7 pueblo joven Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Rossy estudió secundaria completa, también  se preparó asistiendo a cursos de cosmetología en un taller. Se casó con el señor Juan Carlos Asmat y tienen una hija de 6 años.
Agradece infinitamente a Manuela Ramos porque gracias a los créditos que recibe puede implementar su negocio. Recuerda que con el primer crédito que recibió de 300 soles para ser devueltos en 4 meses, inició su negocio, empezó vendiendo mazmorra, papa rellena, ganchitos de pelo, etc.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar, papa, aceite, pollo, cebolla en papa y otros materiales que le puedan servir para la elaboración de sus productos.
Rossy es una mujer emprendedora que no sólo vende comida sino incursiona en el mundo de la moda, vendiendo aretes y ganchitos de pelo.
Rossy sueña siempre con tener un restaurant muy bonito, donde pueda dar trabajo a otras personas, además sueña con estudiar una carrera para tener  mayor preparación.
texts.en:
Rossy Paola is a member of the Jerid Camino al Éxito community bank, is 27 years old and lives on Andrés Tello street, block 1, lot 7 in the town of Aurora Díaz, Salaverry district, Trujillo district, La Libertad department in Perú. Rossy finished secondary school and also attended cosmetology courses in a workshop. She married Juan Carlos Asmat and they have a six year old daughter. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization because thanks to the loans that she has received she has been able to set up her business. She remembers that with the first loan of 300 Soles that she received that was repaid in 4 months she started her business selling mazmorra (corn pudding dessert), stuffed potatoes, hairpins, etc. With this loan of 1,000 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she plans to purchase potatoes, oil, chicken, onions and other materials that will help her prepare her products. Rossy is a very enterprising woman that not only sells food but also words in the fashion world, selling earrings and hairpins. Rossy always has dreamt of having a very nice restaurant, where she could employ other people, as well as studying for another career to be more skilled.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, oil, chicken, onions and other ingredients for the preparation of her food products

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa C. tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casada, y tiene una hija de 11 años de edad. Trabaja en un colegio de Managua y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de perfumes y zapatos, tiene 4 años de experiencia en estas ventas, y 8 años de trabajar para éste colegio. El negocio de las ventas lo inició debido a la necesidad de tener más ingreso para sustentar a su familia. El préstamo solcitado será usado para la construcción de un baño en su vivienda, ya que actualmente no tiene uno completamente acondicionado, y desea darle mayor comodidad a su familia
texts.en:
Rosa C. is 42 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood. She is married and has an 11 year old daughter. She works at a school in Managua and in her free time she dedicates herself to the sale of perfumes and shoes. She has four years of experience in these sales and has been working for the school for 8 years. She started her business in sales because of her need to increase her income in order to support her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to build a bathroom in her home as she currently does not have one that is fully equipped and she wishes to provide the most comfort for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom.

loans.name: Erminia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Erminia Isabel Áreas tiene 43 años de edad su estado civil es de acompañada, tiene 3 hijos con edades comprendidas entre 20, 18 y 14 años de edad todos estudian actualmente la secundaria en un colegio publico  su compañero de vida es soldador, también presta los servicio como aserrador, lo propósitos que desea lograr son trabajar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida como es en cuanto a infraestructura se refiere ya que sus condiciones son bastante limitadas y en época de invierno se ve afectada así poder proporcionarle a sus hijos un hogar  y un techo donde vivir.

La actividad económica de doña Erminia, es el destace de cerdo, compra y venta de cerdo en pie, comprando en zonas aledañas dentro de su jurisdicción domiciliar siendo esta en Quezalguaque, el tiempo que tiene de tener el negocio es de 2 años y medio el negocio empieza de la necesidad  de ayudarle a su compañero en los gastos correspondientes de su casa por lo que cada día que pasa las cosas están mas difíciles debido a la diferente situación económica y el costo de la vida esta mas difícil y tratar de esta forma de obtener otros ingresos  para el hogar y poder ayudar en la manutención de la familia con la ayuda de la organización fundación león 2000 y aquellos programas que beneficien a nuestros microempresarios con visión de negocio.
texts.en:
Erminia Isabel Áreas is 43 years old, lives with her partner and has three children ages 10, 18 and 14, all of whom study in a public secondary school. Her life-long partner is a welder and also works as a lumberjack. The goals she wishes to achieve are work to improve their living conditions with regard to the infrastructure as her living conditions are rather limited and in winter greatly affected so she would like to be able to provide her children a home and a roof where they can live. Erminia has a business raising, selling and butchering pigs. She buys in neighboring villages within her home’s region, which is Quezalguaque. She has had this business for 2.5 years, beginning the business out of the necessity to help her partner with the household expenses because every day that passes things are more difficult due to the different economic situation and the cost of living is more difficult and this is a way to obtain additional income for the home and help support the family with the help of the León 2000 Foundation organization and those programs that benefit our microbusinesses with a business vision.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Segunda

texts.es:
La señora Segunda C. A. tiene 55 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis y al Comedor Popular de su caserío. Vive en el sector de Carata 061 del caserío de Motil, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año de educación Primaria y no continuó porque se quedó huérfana de madre y al papá no le interesaba que las hijas mujeres tengan instrucción. Se casó y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales  sólo uno dependen de ella. 
Segunda, como toda mujer emprendedora, realiza diversos negocios, compra y vende animales, entre ellos cerdos, ovejas y cuyes, los vende en carne o vivos y elabora pan, compra y vende leña. Su negocio se ubica en  su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró animales y leña para su uso personal y para vender.
Con este crédito de 1,500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar animales y materiales para la elaboración de pan.
Su sueño es tener un gran negocio para poder ayudar a los más necesitados.
texts.en:
Segunda C. A. is 55 years old and is a member of the San Luis y al Comedor Popular community bank in her area. She lives in the Carata 061 sector in the area of Motil, Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department in Perú. She studied until the second grade and didn't continue because her mother died and it wasn't important to her father that girls receive an education. She got married and has 4 children, of which only one is still dependent on her. Segunda, like all enterprising women, performs various jobs. She sells and buys animals, such as pigs, sheep, and guinea pigs; she sells them alive or as meat. She also makes bread and buys and sells firewood. Her business is located in her house. With her first loan of 300 Soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she bought animals and firewood for her personal use as well as to sell. With this loan of 1,500 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she plans to buy animals as well as materials for making bread. Her dream is to have a big business to be able to help the needy.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals and materials for making bread

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Doña Orbelina R. S. tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera, con 3 hijos las edades  de sus hijos son de: 16, 28 y 14 años,  el mayor de sus hijos trabaja por cuenta propia sus otros dos hijos cursan la secundaria, su compañero de vida  es comerciante, los propósitos que ella tiene es que sus hijos tengan su carrera  y logren finalizarla ya que es muy difícil poder finalizar completamente los estudios debido a las diferentes dificultades económicas que se presentan, otro de los propósitos que ella tiene es poder mejorar un poco las condiciones de vivienda, la cual pretende ir mejorando poco a poco producto de las ganancias que le genere su actividad económica. Siendo esta la venta de mercadería como ropa nueva, cosméticos por encargo, comprando dos veces al mes  en Managua de acuerdo a los pedidos, el tiempo que doña Orbelina tiene de tener el negocio es de 20 años de estar activa dedicándose en tiempo completo a ella le gusta esta digna actividad  por la cual dice que no la cambiaria ya que trabaja en su casa y la mayoría de  sus clientes llegan a buscarla a su casa el financiamiento de esta será productiva para ella ya que obtendrá mejoras para su negocio y de esta forma obtener los mejores ingresos para su familia. Con la ayuda de los créditos pretende instalar una tienda en su casa de habitación mas adelante ya que sus clientes le conocen.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orbelina R. S. is 48 years old, single, and has three children who are 14, 16, and 28 years old. Her oldest child works and supports himself, but her other children are still in high school. Her life partner is a merchant. Her dream in life is that her children can finish their schooling which is very difficult to do since many economic difficulties present themselves which can keep them from finishing their studies. She also hopes to improve her family's housing conditions, which she has been able to do little by little from the income from her business. She works selling new clothing and cosmetics which she purchases twice a month in Managua depending on her orders. Orbelina has worked full-time in sales for 20 years; she loves her works because it allows her to work from her home where her customers seek her out. She is seeking a loan in order to finance her business which will help her increase her family's income. Through the loan, she will construct a small store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia tiene 25 años de edad, es secretaria del Banco Comunal Mujeres Decididas II y vive en la calle Copaibas Mz 19 lote 9ª de la urbanización La Rinconada de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió computación, pero no pudo terminar porque tuvo su hijo, es madre soltera y mantiene sola a su niño.
Para mantenerse y mantener a su niño decidió poner una bodega en su casa, que luego gracias a su empeño y dedicación está viendo crecer.
Con el primer monto de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas implementó la tienda.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, piensa surtir la tienda con algunas cosas que sus propios clientes le han sugerido.
Silvia sueña con complementar su tienda con una librería y luego realizar un viaje por todo el mundo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia is 25 years old, and is the secretary of the Decided Women II community bank. She lives at 19 lot 9 of Copaibas Street in the city of Rinconada, in the province of Trujillo in the suburb of La Libertad, Perú. She studied computation, but was not able to finisher her education because she gave birth to her son. She is a single mother, and takes care of her son alone. To support herself and her son, Silvia decided to open a grocery store in her house, which later, thanks to her hard-work and dedication, is growing. With the first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, she opened the store. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months as well, Silvia plans to supply the store with some items that her clients have asked for. Silvia dreams of complementing her store with a bookstore, and later taking a trip around the world.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with items requested by clients

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.es:
El nombre del cliente es Martha Carolina P. C. tiene 35 años de edad, su estado civil es  casada, tiene 3 hijos  las edades de sus hijos son de:18, 15 y 11 años de edad los dos mayores cursan la secundaria y el menor actualmente cursa el sexto grado de primaria, su compañero de vida trabaja en la compra de artesanía, los propósito y sueños que desea lograr son : poder contar con un negocio lo suficientemente rentable con el cual pueda ayudar a los diferentes gastos del núcleo familiar. Otros de los deseos es que sus hijos logren coronar una carrera como profesionales siendo uno de los principales motivos para ella, para que en el futuro puedan defenderse por sus propios medios.

En cuanto a su actividad económica actual, esta es la comercialización de artesanía, en el poblado de la calle real de Tolapa municipio de Malpaisillo, tendiendo 11 años de tener su negocio, el negocio fue heredado por sus familiares ya ella se dedicaba a la elaboración  de loza y hoy en día la comercializa fuera de la comunidad debido a la afluencia de extranjeros en el lugar una de las formas en ella   logra venderla de forma ambulante y que los clientes puedan apreciar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha Carolina P. C. is 35 years old and is married with three children who are 11, 15, and 18 years old. The two oldest children are in high school and the youngest is still in 6th grade in elementary school. Her husband is an artisan making various handicrafts. Her dreams are to have a profitable company that can pay her family's expenses, and for her children to become professionals in the careers of their choice. One of the principal motives for her work is to be able to provide for herself and her family on her own. Currently, she sells handicrafts in the neighborhood on Tolapa Street in Malpaisillo. She has run her business for 11 years; inheriting it from her relatives. She has worked making china which she sells outside of her neighborhood since there are more affluent foreigners outside of her neighborhood. She does not have a fixed locale and generally sells walking through neighborhoods and markets to commercialize her work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad, junto a su familia habitan en el barrio memorial sandino. Trabaja como operador de limpieza  en una empresa de managua, tiene 17 años dedicandose a esta labor y empezó como ayudante de limpieza. En estos momentos José desea hacer una extensión a su vivienda, para darle más comodidad a su familia, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, para hacer esa construcción
texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old and is married with two children ages 12 and 11. He lives with his family in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He works as a janitor at a company in Managua. He has dedicated himself to this work for 17 years. Currently, Jose wants to expand his home in order to provide more comfort for his family which is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an expansion to his home.

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Marina R. Rodríguez tiene 37 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y vive en la calle Manuel Gonzales Prada s/n en el distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero ya no tuvo apoyo de sus padres y no pudo seguir estudiando.
Se casó a los 24 años con el señor Hugo Cerna y tiene 2 hijos que aún son estudiantes.
Empezó haciendo negocio de carne, pero probó comprando y vendiendo madera y como le rindió mayores ganancias se quedó con ese negocio. Ahora compra madera en los bosques y luego realizan la tala, las ramas de los árboles las pelan y las usan como leña y el palo grueso lo alistan para madera.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, recuerda que compró dos cerdos que los vendió en carne porque en ese tiempo se dedicaba a ese negocio.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en madera sin preparar, eso quiere decir que lo comprará en planta, entonces aprovecha también la leña.
Sonia sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales y viajar con ellos a conocer otros países.
texts.en:
Sonia Marina R. Rodríguez is 37 years old, is a member of the Mujeres del Mañana (Women of Tommorow) community bank, and lives on Manuel Gonzales Prada street, Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad province in Peru. She finished primary school but didn't have the support of her parents and couldn't continue studying. She got married at the age of 24 to Hugo Cerna and have two school aged children. She started in the meat selling business, but also tried her hand at buying and selling wood, which turned to be more profitable so she ended up with this business. Currently, she buys trees in the forest and later fells them. She peels the branches which are then used for firewood and uses the trunks as general wood. With her first loan of 300 Soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she purchased two pigs that she sold as meat, since that was her business at the time. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she plans to invest in purchasing unprepared wood, in other words still in the ground, to be used for firewood. Sonia dreams of seeing her children becoming professionals and traveling with them to visit other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Susana Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Susana Alvina tiene 36 años de edad, es la fiscal del Banco Comunal  Mujeres al Progreso y vive en Mz 23 lote 5ª en sector Víctor Raúl II etapa Barrio II A, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú. 
Estudió primaria completa y ya no continuó estudiando porque tuvo que ayudar en su hogar, ya que su madre en esa época estaba muy delicada de salud. Se casó a la edad de 20 años con el señor Julio Padilla Pereda con quien tiene una hija que es estudiante y depende de ella.
Empezó comprando chatarra y vendiéndola, ahora compra chatarra y la vende inmediatamente y recicla toda clase de desechos.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró piezas viejas en los mecánicos y las desarmó para venderlas.
Con este crédito de 400 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará animales para usarlos haciendo trueque en la sierra, donde cambiará con piezas de reciclaje.
Susana sueña con tener una ferretería grande donde pueda brindar empleo.
texts.en:
Susana Alvina is 36 years old, is a member of the Mujeres al Progreso community bank and lives at block 23, lot 5ª in the Victor Raúl II sector, El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department in Peru. She finished primary school and didn't continue studying because she had to help out in her household, since at that time her mother was in bad health. She married at the age of 20 to Julio Padilla Pereda with whom she has a daughter that is a student and dependent upon her. She started buying scrap metal and selling it; she continues doing this as well as recycling all forms of waste products. With her first loan of 300 Soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she purchased old pieces of machinery and dissembled them to sell as parts. With this loan of 400 Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy animals to barter with in the mountains in exchange for recycling items. Susana dreams of having a large hardware store in which she can provide jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals

loans.name: Taurina

texts.es:
La señora Taurina tiene 71 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Valerosas II y vive en la calle Santa Rosa 901 del distrito D. La Esperanza Alta, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió solamente transición que equivale al primer grado D. primaria, pero es autodidacta, sola aprendió a leer y a escribir, no continuo estudiando porque no tuvo apoyo departe D. sus padres, su mamá falleció cuando era muy niña. Se casó y tiene 10 hijos, dos fallecieron y con ella no está ninguno, pero tiene a su cargo un nieto y a su cuñada que es especial.
Empezó su negocio vendiendo alfalfa por pocos, vendió media arroba, luego bajo un poco, hasta que llegó a la esquina que venD. en la actualidad y venD. D. 4 a 5 arrobas por día, también cria y venD. animales como le piden sus clientes, bien pelados o en pie. VenD. en la esquina del Mercado la Victoria ,calle Benito Juárez D. La Esperanza Alta.
Su primer préstamo fue D. 200 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró alfalfa y comida para animales.
Con este crédito D. 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará alfalfa y comida para animales, además comprará 4 cuyes para cambiar la raza D. sus cuyes.
Taurina es una mujer muy valerosa, todo lo que gana es para sostener el hogar porque lo que lleva su esposo sirve para su propia medicina ya que se encuentra delicado D. salud.
Su gran sueño es arreglar su casa y no deberle a nadie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Taurina is 71 years old and belongs to the Valiant Women II Community Bank. She lives at 901 Santa Rosa Street in the district of La Esperanza Alta, in the province of Trujillo, in the suburb of La Libertad, Perú. She only completed school through the first graD., but taught herself to read and write. She stopped studying because she did not have the support of her parents, and because her mom died when she was a young girl. Taurina married and has 10 children, two of which died, and the rest do not live with her. She currently takes care of her grandson and his wife. Taurina began her business of selling alfalfa in small quantities. She first sold a half bushel, and later a bit less, until she finally arrived at the corner where she currently sells, and is able to sell 4 to 5 bushels per day. Taurina also raises and sells animals as her clients request them, skinned or alive. She sells on corner of Mercado la Victoria and Benito Juárez D. La Esperanza Alta. Her first loan of 200 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, Taurina used to purchase alfalfa and food for animals. With this 1,000 soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, Taurina will purchase alfalfa and food for animals, as well as 4 guinea pigs to change the race of her current guinea pigs. Taurina is a very brave woman. Everything that she earns she uses to sustain her home because her husband's income is used to purchase medicine for him, as he has health problems. Taurina's dream is to organize the house and not owe anyone anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa and animal feed as well as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Tempora Doris

texts.es:
La señora Témpora Doris tiene 38 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Hilos de Plata y vive en la Mz 25 lote 2 Víctor Raúl - sector Manuel Arévalo, distrito de Huanchaco.
Estudió solamente Primaria completa, pero no continuó porque no tuvo apoyo de sus padres. Se casó aun siendo una niña de trece años y tuvo su primer hija a los 19 años, actualmente tiene 4 hijos, los cuatro estudiantes.
Empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos de belleza, pero no ganaba lo que esperaba, así que cambió de negocio, comenzó a vender fruta en forma ambulatoria, ahora tiene un puesto ambulante fuera del mercado Acomar y vende fruta y verdura.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró un saco de papa, verdura y fruta.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará  yuca, lechuga, alverja y frejol.
Doris sueña con ver profesionales a sus hijos y tener un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Témpora Doris is 38 years old and belongs to the Silve Thread Bank. She lives at la Mz 25 lot 2 of Victor Raúl, sector Manuel Arévalo, in the district of Huanchaco. Témpora completed her formal education through elementary school, but did not continue because she did not have her parents' support. She married while she was still a 13 year-old girl and had her first child at age 19. She currently has 4 children, who are all school-aged. She began selling beauty products, but did not earn as much as she had hoped, so she shifted her business, and began working as a traveling fruit saleswoman. Témpora now has mobile booth outside the Acomar Market, and sells fruits and vegetables. With the first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, Témpora purchased potatoes, fruits and vegetables. With this 300 soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase yuca, lettuce, peas, and beans. Témpora dreams of watching her children grow up to be professionals, and having success in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase yuca, lettuce, peas, and beans

loans.name: Arely Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Arely es una señora trabajadora desde muy joven se ha dedicado a las ventas ambulantes de cosméticos y otros, tiene 40 años de edad, casada y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte, tiene tres hijos que ya son independiente, su esposo es comerciante y vende en un mercado que se llama oriental, se dedica a la venta  de llantas usadas y siempre ha apoyado a su esposa. La Sra. Arely ha logrado poner una pulpería, con ganancias de los productos de la venta de cosmético y con dinero que su esposo le ha dado, ya lleva cinco años en este negocio, pues aunque las ventas a veces son bajas no se deja de vender. Con la solicitud de dinero es para invertir en capital en la compra de mercadería varias para surtir la pulpería y atraer más clientela con su variedad de productos. Alargo plazo es tener mas inventario, captar mas clientes y poner una vitrina de venta de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
Arely is a hard-working woman who, from a young age, has dedicated herself to selling cosmetics and other items door-to-door. She is 40 years old, married, and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte in the capital city of Managua. She has three grown children who are now on their own. Her husband is a merchant who works in a market called the Oriental selling merchandise such as used tires, and he has always supported his wife. Arely has managed to install a general store using funds acquired through her cosmetics sales as well as money contributed by her husband. She now has spent five years in this business and, even though sales are sometimes slow, she never stops selling. With the request for this loan, she would like to invest in the purchase of additional varied merchandise to supply her store with, to be able to attract more customers by offering a wide variety of products. Long-term, she would like to have a greater inventory, capture more customers, and add a sales display window for her cosmetics and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Daysi Dominga

texts.es: Doña Daysi tiene 47 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama 22 de Enero, con tres hijos mayores de edad, que ya trabajan y son independientes. Está orgullosa de haber sacado a sus hijos adelante, su negocio es la costura, tiene ocho años de experiencias, inició con capital propio. Con la solicitud de préstamo  es para comprar tela y hacer trajes de niños y venderlos y así ayudarse, también poder captar mas clientes. A largo plazo es crecer en su negocio y poner una tienda, poder mejorar su vivienda y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Daysi Lopez is 47 years old and lives in a neighborhood called 22 de Enero in the capital city of Managua. She has three grown-up children who work and are independent. She is proud to have helped her children get ahead in life. She has her own sewing business with 8 years of experience. She started out with her own capital. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase fabric and make children’s outfits that she will later sell. This way, she can both help herself out and gain more customers. Her long-term goal is to make her business grow and set up a shop so that she can make house repairs and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Zenaida Marcionila

texts.es:
La señora Zenaida Marcionila A. V., tiene 70 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y vive en la calle Antenor Orrego 129 del distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Cursó hasta tercer año de primaria y no siguió estudiando porque no hubo apoyo de parte de sus padres. Se casó a los 16 años con el señor Eduardo Gamboa y tuvieron 10 hijos, dos de ellos fallecidos, cuando eran pequeños. Actualmente tiene a su cargo una nieta que todavía estudia. 
Empezó su negocio vendiendo fruta y otros productos que se pueden comprar en el lugar, pero luego advirtió que más se gana en la venta de la cerveza, ahora eso es lo que vende.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró y vendió fruta.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará cerveza, fruta y galletas.
Zenaida sueña con viajar y conocer varios lugares que no conoce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zenaida Marcionila A. V. is 70 years old and belongs to the Women of Tomorrow Community Bank. She lives at 129 Antenor Orrego in the district of Agallpampa, in the province of Otuzco, in the suburb of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the third year of elementary school, but did not continue because she did not have her parents' support. Zenaida got married at age 16 with Eduardo Gamboa, and the couple had 10 children. Two of the children died when they were young. Currently, Zenaida looks after a granddaughter who is still a student. She began her business selling fruit and other products, but later noticed that selling beer was more profitable, and so she now sells beer. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, Zenaida purchased and sold fruit. With this 800 soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, Zenaida will purchase beer, fruit and crackers. Zenaida dreams of traveling and visiting many places that she has not been.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, fruit and crackers

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Argentina tiene 40 años de edad,  habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Sabana grande, soltera, no tiene hijos y ayuda a su hermano a criar a sus sobrinos, el negocio de doña Rosa es la elaboración de cosa de horno, pues tiene treinta años de experiencia ya que es una herencia de su madre ya que desde muy joven ayudaba hacer los ricos horneados lo cual ahora ha sido su fuente de trabajo para sobrevivir. Con la solicitud de trabajo es para comprar más insumos para aumentar la producción de ventas de cosa de horno. A largo plazo es tener vendedores que le vendan el producto y poder enseñar a su familia para que también sea una herencia y puedan seguir trabajando en este negocio.
texts.en:
Senora Rosa Argentina is 40 years old and lives in a neighborhood in Managua called Sabana Grande. She is single and does not have any children, but she helps her brother raise his children. Rosa makes and sells grilled snacks for a living. She inherited this trade from her mother, and after 30 years it is her only source of income to live on. She needs to purchase the necessary ingredients to increase her production and sales. Her long term plan is to have salespeople who can sell her products, and to be able to teach others in her family this trade so they can inherit it and continue with the business.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients she needs to increase production and sales of the local snacks she makes and sells

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Elba D. es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua y se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de ropa el cual lo comercializa en su propia casa de habitación y a la vez sale ambulantemente ofreciendo el producto en diversos sectores.

La necesidad que actualmente ella atraviesa es que le urge obtener el capital financiero para la compra de la ropa. Es por este motivo que ella busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir la mercadería y asi continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Elba D. is from the Sandino City neighborhood of the city of Managua. She works very hard at her business selling clothes, which she sells from her own home. She also sells the clothing as a street vendor in various neighborhoods.

She currently has an urgent need to obtaining financing to buy clothing. For this reason she has turned to Ceprodel for help in obtaining a loan which will allow her to buy merchandise and thus continue maintaining her family.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Fabia Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Fabia Patricia O. Loaisga, tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es de soltera, tiene 1 hija con la edad de 14 años  que actualmente esta cursando el sexto grado de primaria uno de los sueños que ella  tiene   es de poder llegar a tener su casa propia para compartirla con su hija ya que para ella esto seria una prioridad para el futuro de su hija de este modo no pase necesidades de andar alquilando, ya que con lo gana no es realmente lo suficiente para poder cumplir este sueño, a corto plazo. Otros de sus propósitos es que su hija logre tener una educación universitaria por consiguiente coronar una carrera  que le favorezca y que sea de provecho en cuanto a factibilidad de empleo inmediato.  

En lo que se refiere a su actividad económica esta es la comercialización de cosméticos exclusivamente de la línea AVON y ZERMAT, teniendo casi catorce años en este negoció, vendiendo productos como: perfumes, cremas, body, pintura de labios y un sin numero de productos comercializando a través de catálogos visitando casa en casa en donde sus clientes puedan escoger el producto de su preferencia. Doña Fabia desea el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de los productos que sus clientes le solicitan de esta forma satisface la demanda de los clientes y una de las medios por los cuales podría lograr sus sueños es por medio del apoyo que le podría brindar Fundación león 2000 con la ayuda de otras organizaciones con el fin de cumplir con estos
texts.en:
Fabia Patricia O. Loaisga is 33 years old and she is single. She has one daughter aged 14 years and she is attending grade 6. One of ther derams is to have her own house to share with her daughter because this would be a priority for the future of her daughter. She doesn't want her to have to keep renting and find herself in need. In the short term the earnings she is accumulating are note enough to make this dream a reality. Another one of her goals is to provide her daughter with a university education and to have a career that she loves and that she will be able to have work immediately.

In what pertains to her financial occupation it is the sale of cosmetics, especially Avon and Zermat brands. Having almost fourteen years in the buisness selling products such as: perfumes, body creams, lipsticks, and countless other products that she offers through a catalogue, visiting house after house where her clients can select the products they prefer. Fabia requests this loan as working capital so that she will be able to purchase products that her clients have ordered and in this manner satisfay the demands of her clientele. One of the ways she will be able to make her dreams come true is through the support that comes from Fundacion Leon 2000 and with the help of other organisations.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
El negocio al que se dedica la señora María Cristina V. es al de pulpería el cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo y gran sacrificio en su propia casa de habitación donde habita con su pequeño hijo al que tiene que mantener.

Es importante mencionar que la señora V. es madre soltera por lo que requiere buenas condiciones en el negocio para mantener a su pequeño niño. Por esta razón es que hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de productos y así surtir sus estantes de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Señora María Cristina V. has a small store that she runs with a great deal of effort and sacrifice out of her own home. She lives there with her small son whom she has to support. It should be noted that Señora V. is a single mother so she needs a solid business in order to support her child. It is for this reason that she is now seeking the assistance of Ceprodel to obtain a loan for the purchase of products to stock the shelves of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Darling Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Darling originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua es una dama que con gran esfuerzo se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de gaseosas atendido amablemente por ella misma en su casa de habitación.

La señora Darling es madre casada y con tres hijos en su responsabilidad. Hoy en día es necesario destacar que ella ha sido una fiel trabajadora por lo que ha logrado suplir la necesidad de su hogar. El motivo por el cual solicita un crédito es para la compra de mercadería y de las bebidas gaseosas para ofrecerlas en su pulpería y de esta forma continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Darling is originally from the Sandino City municipality in Managua. She is a lady who, with great effort, dedicates herself to a general store business and soft drink sales. She tends amiably to her business herself, in her own home.

Darling is a married mother responsible for three children. Today, it is necessary to emphasize that she has been a loyal worker who has as a result managed to provide the necessities for her home. The motivation for her loan request is for the purchase of merchandise and sodas to offer for sale in her store so she can continue to help support her household.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Hoy en día el negocio de pulpería requiere de mucha inversión por la razón de que hay mucha competencia y si no se invierte, difícilmente se podrá mantener el negocio en el mercado. Consciente de esto la señora Mercedes E. se ha dedicado a su negocio de pulpería atendido en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Ella es una dama con la obligación de mantener a su amada familia siendo este el motive por el cual se ha preocupado por mejorar el negocio. Para ello solicita un crédito en Ceprodel esperando que este sea aprobado y así mejorar su condición económica y el de su hogar.
texts.en:
Nowadays a small store requires a great deal of investment because there is a lot of competition, and if one doesn’t invest, it is difficult to keep up in the marketplace. Mindful of this, Señora Mercedes E. works hard running her store out of her house in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino. She is responsible for the support of her beloved family. This is the reason she is anxious to improve the business. She is hoping that her request for a loan through Ceprodel will be approved so she will be then be able to improve the financial situation of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El joven Guillermo E. es casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su amada familia. Se dedica a la labor de venta de productos ferreteros en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de Managua.

Es importante destacar que desde que inició su negocio hace 5 años comenzó vendiendo pocos productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado surtir la ferretería por lo que ahora tiene más deseos de desarrollarse. Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros y de esta forma mejorar aun más el negocio.
texts.en:
The young man Guillermo E. is married and has the responsibility of supporting his beloved family. His job is selling hardware in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino de Managua. It should be noted that when he began the business five years ago, he was only selling a few products, but as time passed, he succeeded in increasing the stock in the hardware store. Now he wishes to expand it further. He is seeking help from Ceprodel to obtain a loan to be used to buy hardware products and thus improve his business even more.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware items

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Hace 4 años en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino el joven Juan Carlos V. inició una pequeña mini pulpería el cual no prestaba las condiciones de infraestructura y además vendía pocos productos. Hoy en dia a medida que los años vinieron transcurriendo ha logrado surtir mucho su pulpería y es por esta razón que se ha levantado muy satisfactoriamente y además ha sido un excelente comerciante en su municipio.

Ceprodel ha sido un apoyo fundamental para este joven por lo que le ha apoyado con créditos que los ha usado directamente en la compra de los productos para el negocio. Una vez más acude a Ceprodel con el mismo objetivo ya que son sus metas mejorar y seguir creciendo perfilándose como un gran comerciante.
texts.en:
Four years ago, the young man Juan Carlos V. opened a small mini-store in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino. He couldn’t borrow money to improve the condition of the building, and he sold very few items. Now with the passage of time, he has succeeded in stocking his store well, and for this reason he has made great progress and is considered an excellent businessman in the municipality. Ceprodel has been a fundamental support for this young man, and the organisation has helped him with loans that he has used to purchase products for the business. Once again he is approaching Ceprodel with the same goal of reaching his objectives and expanding the business. His plan to become a great businessman is taking shape.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana Feliciana

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es el negocio al cual la señora Juana Feliciana se dedica con el objetivo de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Todos los días desde que comienza el día ella se prepara para ofrecer la ropa en sui casa de habitación y en ocasiones ella la vende ofreciéndolas en otros lugares donde cree que pueden ser compradas.

Debido a su ardua labor ha logrado mantener su hogar en buenas condiciones y según comenta esto se lo debe a Ceprodel por haberle brindado créditos los cuales los ha utilizado directamente en el negocio. Por esto es que una vez más acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Feliciana’s job is selling clothes in order to provide for her family. Every day from early in the morning she sells clothes from her home and occasionally takes the clothing around to other places where she believes she will make a sale. Because of her hard work, she has managed to keep her home in good condition. She says that she owes Ceprodel a lot for having given her loans that she has used directly in the business. For this reason she is once again approaching Ceprodel for a loan so that she can improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Adela María

texts.es:
Adela C. es una dama que por cinco años se ha dedicado al negocio de atención de su pulpería el cual requiere de mucha inversión por la sencilla razón de que hoy en día se han levantado negocios similares a su alrededor y cada día su entorno externo le exige invertir más en su negocio.

Por este motive es que ella ha buscado refugio en Ceprodel por medio de la solicitud de créditos los cuales los necesita para surtir sus estantes y así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y mejorar su situación económica que tanto lo requiere.
texts.en:
Adela C. is a woman who, for the past five years, has dedicated herself to tending to her grocery store business. It requires a great deal of investment for the simple reason that these days similar businesses have cropped up around her, and these outside pressures are forcing her to invest more into her enterprise.

This is the reason she is seeking refuge in Ceprodel, by way of requesting the loans which she needs in order to supply her store. That way, she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers and improve her economic situation which she so needs to do.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget S., who lives in Angk Prasath Village in Takeo Province, is both a farmer and a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock for later resale at a better price.  Her husband, Mr. Lay Sophon, is a duck breeder who currently does not have enough money to buy sufficient food for them. Thus, his wife is requesting a loan to buy food for this purpose. 
	
Nget is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the remaining two, one and five years old, are at home.  Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food for her husband's business.

loans.name: Phem

texts.en: Mrs. Phem N., a 59-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is a bodyguard while the remaining three are attending the local school, lives in Prey Khla Tboung Village in Takeo Province.  Phem owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living, but she currently lacks sufficient funds to hire a laborer to plow the rice field. She is therefore requesting a loan for this purpose and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to support her crop.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to support her crop.

loans.name: Mrs. Mork Nhoth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mork N., a group leader of five who all live in Svay Prey Village in Kampong Cham Province, recently married Mrs. Yorn Yeth, a construction worker. They have no children. Mork owns a small plot of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living, but the land has become infertile. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizers in order to produce a good crop.

Because Mrs. Sun S., one of the group members, was not available for the picture, her husband is shown instead.

This is a group loan consisting of end-of-term loans with the exception of one group member who has a monthly payment loan. Such members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Christine Nalubega's Group

texts.en:
Christine is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is 36 years old and married with 6 children, aged between 18 years and 4 months. Four of her children go to school. She resides in a one-roomed house, where she is staying with eight people. Christine takes care of three orphans: her late brother's children. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day. They rarely take tea.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Christine sells food products like cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes in Kawaala market near her home. She doesn't incur any transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She can sell to an average of 15 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business and home, food and school fees for the orphans. Christine works seven days a week.

Christine has been with MCDT for four years, working with the same groupmates. She is servicing her eighth loan and is aspiring to see her business expand so that she can start going to the villages to get stocks herself.

loans.use: To boost her food product business

loans.name: Ni Putu Muliasih

texts.id: Memelihara sapi sudah pekerjaan yang biasa bagi ibu 2 anak ini. Walaupun memerlukan tenaga yang ekstra karena harus mencari rumput, tetapi Ni Putu Muliasih tidak sendiri. Ni Putu Muliasih dibantu suami dalam menjalani usaha ini. 2 ekor anak sapi yang dipelihara harus mendapat perhatian yang baik agar pertumbuhannya baik sehingga bisa dijual dengan harga tinggi. Untuk itu setiap hari setelah selesai memasak, Ni Putu Muliasih mencari pakan seperti rumput dan berbagai jenis dedaunan. Dalam 1 tahun dari hasil penjualan 2 ekor anak sapi sebesar Rp.10.000.000,- Ni Putu Muliasih  mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 5.000.000,-  Ni Putu Muliasih juga membeli pakan berupa konsentrat untuk sapi. Keuntungan ini sangat membantu keluarga Muliasih karena sangat lumayan keuntungannya.Untuk pinjaman ini Ni Putu Muliasih ingin memelihara lebih banyak sapi lagi sehingga keuntungan yang didapat lebih banyak. Dengan Pinjaman Rp. 6.000.000.- Ni Putu Muliasih bisa membeli 2 ekor anak sapi.
texts.en:
Raising cow has become customary work to this mother and child. Although required extra energy due to the need to find grass, but Ni Putu Muliasih is not alone. Ni Putu Muliasih is assisted by her husband to undertake this effort. Two calves being reared is given good attention in order that they grow well until they can be sold for a good price. For that, everyday after completing cooking, Ni Putu Muliasih seeks grass and various leaves. In a year, revenue from selling 2 calves amounts to Rp. 10.000.000,- Ni Putu Muliasih obtain profit of Rp. 5.000.000,- Ni Putu Muliasih also purchase special feed for the calves. This profit assists her family, as their income is mediocre. For this loan Ni Putu Muliasih intend to raise more calves to increase her income. With loan of Rp. 6.000.000,- Ni Putu Muliasih can buy 2 calves.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves and supplies (Membeli anak sapi dan pakannya)

loans.name: Davlatbibi

texts.ru:
Султонова Давлатбиби, 1968 года рождения. Она замужем и у нее 3 детей. Начала предпринимательскую деятельность 8 лет назад с продажи детских носков. Сейчас у Давлатбиби широкий ассортимент детской одежды, начиная от детских маек и трусиков до джинсовых брюк и костюмчиков. Закупает свой товар на оптовом рынке и продает на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района. В сезон хочет пополнить ассортимент осенними товарами. 
Услышав про программу Кива захотела участвовать и получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Davlatbibi S. was born in 1968. She is married and has 3 children. Davlatbibi started her business 8 years ago by selling children’s socks. Toda,y Davlatbibi has a wide assortment of children’s clothing, ranging from children’s undershirts and underwear to jeans and suits. Davlatbibi purchases her products at the wholesale market and sells them at the “Muboriz” market in the Gissar region. She would like to supplement her product assortment with fall products.

After hearing about Kiva she wanted to participate and to take out a loan for 3500 somoni ($1050).

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fall products

loans.name: Ni Nengah Wardani

texts.id: Usaha ternak sapi adalah suatu kegiatan yang tidak pernah ditinggalkan oleh Ni Nengah Wardani. Suaminya juga membantu dalam usaha ini. Mencari rumput untuk sapinya adalah suatu pekerjaan yang sering dilakukan oleh suami Ni Nengah Wardani. Setiap hari pukul 06.00 pagi sudah sibuk memberi makan rumput yang sudah dipersiapkan sore harinya. Sedang untuk siang hari dibiarkan di kebunnya untuk mencari makan sendiri. Menjelang malam hari pukul 06.00  sore juga sibuk untuk memberi makan sapinya. Kegiatan ini dilakukan dengan harapan 2 ekor sapinya yang baru dibelinya tetap sehat. Persediaan pakan hijauan tidak pernah kekurangan. Selain memberi pakan campuran, pakan hijauan juga tetap harus diberikan. Dalam 1 tahun dijual dengan harga Rp.10.000.000.- 2 ekor sapi dengan keuntungan Rp. 3.500.000 bersih. Keuntungan ini untuk biaya 3 anak yang masih sekolah dan bisa membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Untuk kedepannya Ni Nengah Wardani ingin memajukan usahanya dan mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari. Pinjaman yang didapatnya direncanakan untuk membeli 2 ekor anak spi dan pakannya.
texts.en:
The effort of raising cows is an activity that will not be passed by Ni Nengah Wardini. Her husband also helps in this effort. Seeking grass for the calves is work frequently carried out by her husband. Everyday at 6 am already busy feeding grass previously readied. While in the afternoon, they are left in the garden to look for food. Towards 6 in the evening again busy providing food to the calves. This activity carried out with the hope that the 2 calves recently purchased will be healthy. Preparing green feed is not lacking. Apart from providing mixed feed, green feed is also required. In a year can be sold for Rp. 10.000.000,- 2 calves with a profit of Rp. 3.500.000,- This profit is for her 3 children’s education and family’s expenses. For the future Ni Nengah Wardini intends to develop this effort and get a loan from Dinari. This loan will be used to purchase 2 calves and supplies.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves and supplies (Membeli anak sapi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suratih

texts.id: Bertempat  tinggal desa Ni Wayan Suratih hidup bersama suaminya yang bernama Nengah Rata. Ni Wayan Suratih mempunyai 6 orang anak yang semuanya sudah menikah dan tinggal dikota. Diusia yang sudah agak lanjut, Ni Wayan Suratih memilih tinggal didesa bersama suaminya. Saat ini Ni Wayan Suratih memelihara 4 ekor babi. Karena kekurangan modal dalam memelihara babi khususnya untuk membeli pakan, Ni Wayan Suratih berniat meminjam dana dari yayasan DINARI melalui Kelompok Wanita Ternak yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli  segala macam kebutuhan pakan babinya. Harapan Ni Wayan Suratih pakan yang akan dibelinya bisa mencukupi kebutuhan untuk babi-babinya. Dengan mendapat pakan yang cukup, Ni Wayan Suratih yakin pertumbuhan babinya akan baik dan bisa dijual dengan harga yang tinggi
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Suratih live in the village with her husband, Nengah Rata. Ni Wayan Suratih has 6 children, all married and living in the city. At an age that is considered advanced, Ni Wayan Suratih chooses to live in the village with her husband. Currently, Ni Wayan Suratih is raising 4 pigs. Because of lacking of funding in raising these pigs especially to buy feeds, Ni Wayan Suratih intend to borrow funding from Dinari foundation through the Women Breeding Group which will be used to purchase all types of feeds for the pigs. Ni Wayan Suratih hopes the feeds purchased is sufficient for the pigs. With adequate feeds, the pigs will be grow well and can be sold at a good and high price.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buys feed (Membeli pakan)

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.ru:
Файзуллоева Рукия, 1975 года рождения. Она замужем и у нее 3 детей. Начала свой бизнес 15 лет назад с продажи товаров народного потребления. Сейчас у нее широкий ассортимент продовольственных товаров и товаров народного потребления. Это разновидность консервов, печений, макаронных изделий, чая кофе и таких товаров как мыло, стиральные и чистящие порошки и т.д. 
Свой товар Рукия закупает в оптовом рынке Сафарцентра и продает на рынке Баракат города Турсунзаде. Для увеличения товарооборота хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для закупа консервов и макаронных изделий.
texts.en:
Rukiya F. is married and has 3 children. She started her business 15 years ago by selling consumer goods. Currently, she has a wide assortment of food and consumer goods. This includes canned goods, cookies, pasta products, tea, coffee and goods, such as soap, detergent and cleaning powders, etc. Rukiya purchases her goods at the Safarcentre wholesale market and sells them at the Barakat market in Tursunzoda. In order to increase her goods turnover, she wants to obtain a $1200 loan for purchasing canned goods and pasta products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and pasta products

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is the leader of this five member group. She is fifty years old and divorced with three children. Her children are between 15 and 20 years old and all attend school. Margaret also takes care of five orphans.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a five-room house where she lives with seven people. They have electricity and piped water at home and the family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business and water and electricity bills.

Margaret is a hard-working lady who operates a kiosk and buys her products from Kampala. She attends to about thirty customers a day. She uses public transport for her commute to buy goods.

Margaret has been with MCDT for ten years and is servicing her twelfth loan. She wants to use this loan to boost her business. Margaret aspires to expand her business, become a serious hotelier, and also own her business premises.

loans.use: To boost her kiosk business.

loans.name: Eom

texts.en: Mrs. Eom N. of Bonteay Village in Takeo Province is a 30-year-old rice farmer and the mother of three children, all in attendance at the local school.  Unfortunately, her rice field has become infertile, so she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to restore it. Her husband, Mr. Siv Sokhorn, shown in the picture, owns a small rice mill that generates an income as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Mrs. Ung S. was born in 1956 and lives in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province where she cultivates rice on a small plot of land. Unfortunately, her field has become infertile so she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to restore it.

Ung is the mother of three children who are employed in a variety of business activities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en:
Madina A. is 28 years old and married with two children, ages 2 and 10. She's been selling octopus and coconut in Zanzibar since 2007. Both foods are local favorites and are commonly eaten by the locals and tourists alike. She is currently able to earn approximately $50 each month.

Madina hopes that her first loan from BRAC Tanzania will enable her to increase her inventory of octopus and coconut and, with it, her profit. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Amina, Sony, Bimkubwa, and Hindu.

loans.use: To buy more octopus and coconut to sell.

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Mrs. Se M., the 28-year-old mother of a three-year-old child, is a rice farmer in Preal Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Sar Pov, is a duck breeder. Se is requesting a loan in order to hire a laborer with a pump and two oxen to both water her crop and plow her rice field; as well, she would like to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

Se’s husband is shown is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru:
Саймуродов Рахмон, 1966 года рождения. Он женат и у них многодетная семья. Вместе с женой они воспитывают 10 детей. Чтоб прокормить большую семью Рахмон решил занятся продажей школьных книг и принадлежностей. Сейчас он в месте со своей женой продают разновидность препаратов для истребления насекомых и грызунов. Продаваемый ими товар всегда в спросе, так как эти препараты часто востребованы в сельской местности. Свои товары Рахмон закупает в оптовом рынке и продает на рынке Мубориз Гисарского района.
Для увеличения товарооборота хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для закупа препаратов от вредителей домашних животных.
texts.en:
Rahmon S. was born in 1966. He is married and raises 10 children with his wife. In order to support his large family, Rahmon decided to start selling school books and supplies. Currently, his wife and he sell a variety of insect- and rodent-controlling pesticides. The goods are always in demand especially in their agricultural locality. Rahmon purchases his goods at a wholesale market and sells them at the Muboriz market in the Gissar district. In order to increase goods turnover, he wants to obtain a $900 loan for purchasing pest control products for domestic animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pest control products for domestic animals

loans.name: Ni Putu Murdani

texts.id: Ni Putu Murdani dan suaminya tinggal disebuah desa. Sebelum menekuni usaha ternak babi, Ni Putu Murdani menekuni usaha ternak ayam. Karena hasilnya tidak memuaskan, akhirnya Ni Putu Murdani berhenti memelihara ayam dan beralih beternak babi. Kebetulan lewat organisasi yang ada di desanya yang bekerja sama dengan Dinari akhirnya membuka peluang untuk kembali berusaha. Selain mendapat pinjaman dana, Ni Putu Murdani juga mendapat pelatihan tentang beternak babi secara baik dan benar. Dengan program pinjaman selama  6 bulan dan pembayaran seluruh pinjaman pada saat akhir periode. Setelah memperoleh dana, Ni Putu Murdani berkeinginan untuk memelihara 2 ekor babi dan membuat kandang yang lebih baik. Ni Putu Murdani berharap dari pinjaman yang diperolehnya nantinya bisa mendukung usahanya. Ni Putu Murdani memiliki 2 orang anak yang sekarang memerlukan biaya banyak untuk pendidikannya dan kebutuhan keluarga yang semakin meningkat.
texts.en:
Ni Putu Murdani and her husband live in a village. Prior to breeding pigs, Ni Putu Murdani was breeding chickens. Because its yield is not sufficient she finally stopped breeding chickens and return to breeding pigs. Lately an organization in the village works with Dinari, which provides opportunities for returning effort. Besides receiving loans, Ni Putu Murdani also receive training on breeding pigs the correct way. With this 6-month loan program which is repayable at the end of the period. After receiving funding, Ni Putu Murdani intends to breed 2 pigs and construct a proper pen. Ni Putu Murdani hope to use the loan granted to support her effort. Ni Putu Murdani has 2 children who currently need funding to pay for their education and the increasing family expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and construct pen (Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang)

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kun B. was born in 1953 and now lives in Preal Village in Takeo Province where she and her husband, Mr. Sin Song, are rice farmers. Kun is requesting a loan to hire two laborers, one to plow the rice field and another with a pump to water her field, and to purchase pesticides. 

Kun has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.
