loans.use: To hire laborers to plow and water the rice field, and to puchase pesticides.

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs. Yeang N., a 26-year-old farmer and mother of two children who attend the local school in Preal Village in Takeo Province, is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers for her currently infertile field. Her husband, Mr. Sieng Ny, is a construction worker who makes a small income that helps support his household.  He is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin K. is a villager in Preal Village in Takeo Province. She is a breeder who raises ducks. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more duck food to feed her ducks. Her husband, Mr. Sum Sae, is a construction worker, who makes a small income to support his family. Mrs. Chin K. does not have any children. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more duck food to feed her ducks.

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru:
Муродова Файзигуль, 1966 года рождения и у нее 4 иждивенцев. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи токи. Сейчас ее ассортимент товаров увеличился, это разновидность токи (национальные головные уборы), махси (национальные сапоги) и чапаны (национальное пальто). Свой товар она закупает у поставщиков из Коканда и продает на Центральном рынке Гисарского района.
Для увеличения товарооборота хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони для закупа чапанов.
texts.en:
Fayzigul M., was born in 1966 and she has 4 dependents. She started her business by selling traditional head coverings. Today, her product assortment has increased. She sells a variety of traditional head coverings, boots, and coats. Fayzigul purchases her products from suppliers from Kokanda and sells them at the central market in the Gissar region. In order to increase her inventory she would like to borrow 3500 somoni ($1050) to purchase traditional coats.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase traditional coats

loans.name: Ni Ketut Tiyarmini

texts.id: Kehidupan yang sangat keras dan kebutuhan hidup yang semakin menuntut, membuat Ni Ketut Tiyarmini terus berusaha tanpa mengenal lelah. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini dulu bekerja di pabrik roti. Namun sekarang pabrik roti itu sudah bangkrut.  Setelah mendapat informasi dari salah satu temannya yang sekarang tergabung dalam kelompok ternak, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini berniat untuk bergabung. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini memiliki 2 orang anak. Anak yang pertama, Ni Putu Dewi Pusparini duduk dibangku SMP, Anak yang kedua bernama Ni Kadek Ayu Bistadewi saat ini  baru SD. Suami Ni Ketut Tiyarmini seorang Pegawai swasta yang penghasilannya dipakai untuk membiayai pendidikan kedua anaknya. Disamping sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini memiliki kesibukan memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Dengan jangka waktu pinjaman 6 bulan. Modal yang didapat dari DINARI Rp. 5.000.000,- dipakai untuk membeli 2 ekor anak babi dan modal pakan babinya. Dengan perawatan dan juga ketelatenannya sekarang ke dua babinya sudah besar dan memerlukan pakan yang banyak. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini juga rajin memberikan dedaunan sebagai makanan selingan. Harapan Ni Ketut Tiyarmini usahanya akan berhasil dan Dinari terus bisa membantu dalam pendanaan dan pelatihan sampai ia menjadi peternak yang sukses.
texts.en:
Hard life and the increasing cost of living, forces Ni Ketut Tiyarmini to work tirelessly. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini previously worked in a bread factory. But the bread factory is now bankrupt. After being informed by a friend who is in the breeding group, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is interested in joining. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini has 2 children. The elder, Ni Putu Dewi Pusparini is in secondary school, the second Ni Kadek Ayu Bistadewi is only in elementary school. Her husband’s income as a private officer is used to cover both children’s education expenses. Besides being a homemaker, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini, is busy breeding 2 pigs. With this 6-month loan, funding received from Dinari Rp. 5.000.000,- is used to purchase 2 piglets and breeding supplies. With care and also perseverance the 2 piglets are now grown and require a lot of feed. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini also diligently provides leaves as food. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini hopes her efforts will yield and Dinari continue to assist in funding and training till she is a successful breeder.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 2 piglets and supplies (Membeli 2 ekor anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van M., born in 1982 and now living in Preak Tamao Village in Takeo Province, owns a small plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. Unfortunately, the field has become infertile, so she is requesting a loan to buy both fertilizers to restore it and more pesticides to control insect infestations. Her husband, Mr. Hao Sith, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Van M. has two children, one three years of age and the other five. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice field.

loans.name: Mpaji's Group

texts.en:
Mpaji A. is 28 years old and married with three children, ages one, two, and three. She also cares for an additional dependent who is six years old. She has been selling dresses, sheets, and other fabrics in Zanzibar for five years. She is currently able to earn approximately $70 each month in profit.

Mpaji hopes that by taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania she will be able to increase her inventory and sales and earn a greater profit. She will use the loan to buy more dresses and fabrics for her shop. Mpaji will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fatma, Asumini, Mwanaid, and Khadija.

loans.use: To buy more dresses and fabrics for her shop.

loans.name: Ghullam

texts.en:
Ghullam H. is 48 years old. He is married and the father of nine children. He lives in the district of Behsood in Jalalabad city and he is an uneducated man. He has his own land and he is a hard worker, working for a long time on this land.

Ghullam grows different kinds of vegetables and wheat on his land and he brings the vegetables to the bazaar to sell. However, his current income of $10 per day is not enough for his household. He wants to increase his income to purchase stock and some seeds for his land; therefore, he requested a 30000AF individual loan from AFGS for 24 months. He thanks his lenders in advance.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat and vegetables

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mrs. On S., a resident of Prey Kla Tboung Village in Takeo Province, owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her field is currently infertile, so she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and more pesticides.

Mrs. On S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one five years old and the other six months old. Her husband, Mr. Neang Veasna, a fisherman, is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and more pesticides for her field.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sutarmi

texts.id: Setiap pukul 08.00 pagi Ni Wayan Sutarmi memberi makan 5 ekor babi peliharaannya. Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya setelah selesai memasak didapur. Kandang bambu  yang dimiliki dibelakang rumah sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Karena bila hanya mengandalkan suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya dirasakan sangat susah. Namun belakangan ini harga pakan sangat tinggi. Untuk mengatsi hal itu, Ni Wayan Sutarmi bergabung dengan program dari Dinari yakni program Ternak Babi yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. Ni Wayan Sutarmi memiliki 1 orang anak yang masih duduk dibangku SD. Semangat untuk berusaha yang dimiliki membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai kepala rumah tangga. Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani yang tidak menentu. Keuntungan yang sudah dirasakan sangat memuaskan.dalam 6 bulan 5 bibit babi ini bisa menghasilkan Rp. 2.000.000-. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya keluarganya dan ditabung untuk keperluan pendidikan anaknya.
texts.en:
Every 8 am Ni Wayan Sutarmi feeds the 5 pigs she is raising. This has become her daily routine after completing cooking in the kitchen. The pigs being raised are housed in the bamboo stall behind her home. This effort greatly assists in covering the family’s expenses. Because only depending on her husband’s to cover the family’s expenses is hardship. Nevertheless lately the prices of supplies are high. To overcome this matter, Ni Wayan Sutarmi participate in the programby Dinari that is a program in rearing pigs over a period of 6 months and at the end of this period repays the loan. Ni Wayan Sutarmi has a child who is in elementary school. Her enthusiasm in this effort eases the burden on her husband as the head of the household. Her husband’s income as a farmer is not definite. Income already earned is very satisfying; in 6 months 5 pigs generated Rp. 2.000.000-. This income is used to cover the family’s expenses and saved for the child’s education.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies (Membeli pakan)

loans.name: Assadllah

texts.en:
Assadllah is married. He lives with his own family. He has a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for a long time. He got the first-cycle loan and used it for his business and until now he is furthering his business. Now he plans to enlarge his business. He wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

Therefore he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to enlarge his shop and complete his stock and change the design of the restaurant. He would love to be a good business dealer in the future.

He is happy. He plans to open another restaurant in the next 5 years. He tries his best to open another restaurant with his income. He wants to say that without this loan it was impossible to get his restaurant to be its best and he hopes that he is going to be the best in the future.

loans.use: To continue to expand his business

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Mrs. Um T., who lives in Prey Chheu Teal Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer while her husband, Mr. Sem Son, is a motorbike taxi driver. Sem's motorbike is very old and gets poor fuel economy, so his wife is requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to purchase a replacement.

Mrs. Um T. is the 46-year-old mother of five children: one is employed in a garment factory; another is a monk; two others are attending the local school while another stays at home doing housework. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add the loan to her savings to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ngoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoy S. M., born in 1969 and now living in Run Village in Takeo Province, has a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her field is currently infertile, so she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to restore it.

Mrs. Ngoy S. M. has four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest is yet too young at the age of five to be a student.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Tojihon

texts.ru:
Касирова Тожихон, 1941 года рождения. У нее большая семья состоящая из 10 иждивенцев. Она начала свой бизнес с носовых платков и насков. Постепенно наращивая опыт увеличивала свой товарооборот. За три года в этом бизнесе она увеличила свой ассортимент. Сейчас Тожихон продает разновидность токи (национальные головные уборы), махси (национальные сапоги) и чапаны (национальное пальто). Также в продаже у нее можно найти головные уборы для религиозных людей. Свой товар она закупает у местных производителей, у поставщиков из Коканда и продает на Центральном рынке Гисарского района.
Для закупа религиозных головных уборов хочет получить займ в сумме 1000 сомони.
texts.en:
Tojihon K. was born in 1941. She has a large family with 10 dependents. She started her business by selling handkerchiefs and socks. Slowly, as she gained experience, she increased her inventory. Over three years in this business she increased her assortment. Right now Tojihon sells a variety of traditional hats, boots and coats. In addition she sells head coverings for religious people. She purchases her products from local producers and from suppliers from Kokanda and sells them at the central market in the Gissar region. She would like to take out a loan for 1000 somoni ($300) to purchase religious head coverings.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase religious head coverings for sale

loans.name: Sabra's Group

texts.en:
Sabra M. is 27 years old and married with two children, ages one and six. She opened her own shop in Zanzibar seven years ago. She sells a wide variety of items, including juice, charcoal, firewood, and food. She is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $60.

Sabra is hoping that her first loan with BRAC Tanzania enables her to expand her inventory and increase her profit. She will use the loan to buy more food and charcoal to sell in her shop. Sabra shares this loan with her fellow group members, Sabiha, Riziki, Zaituni, and Fatma.

loans.use: To buy more food and charcoal to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Christine Nalugo's Group

texts.en:
Christine is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is 22 years old and married with one child aged 3 years. Her child goes to school. She resides and rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with three people, and doesn't take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Christine deals in new shoes and operates from Owino park yard, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. Christine buys from supplying shops within Kampala city. She uses public transport from Owino to her home. Christine sells to an average of 5 people a day, selling to men only, and works six days a week. Christine's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises at 30,000/=, accommodation at 25,000/= , food and medication. Christine has been in this business for 2 years. Christine first dealt in second hand shirts and then shifted to men's shoes.

Christine has been with MCDT for 1 1/2 years and is serving her sixth loan. She wants to boost her business and aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she can start to sell wholesale and rent a shop.

loans.use: To boost her shoe sale business

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Mrs. Pheng S., who lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Saom Srey Ny, is a construction worker who makes a small income that helps to support his family.  In order to reduce his high commuting costs, Pheng is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for him to use.  Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 43-years-old and married with five kids. She is resourceful and supportive to her family. Currently, Augustina supports all her kids in school. She operates a local restaurant and has been selling local foods like banku and fufu for the past year. She says that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenditure. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Augustina is a member of a group called Adekyensroma Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Mrs. Reth M. is 48 years old and lives in Preah Punlea Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province. She is married to Mr. Him Samut, 53, who transports water to sell to customers at home; he has been selling since 2000 and earns about $5 per day. Reth has seven children, two of whom are married and five of whom live at home. Two of her children run a money-exchange business.  Reth sells cooked rice with fried chicken and pork to customers in her area; she earns about $10 per day.  To increase her family's income, Reth needs a loan of $1,100 to purchase a store in which to operate her cooked rice business; she will use the remainder of the loan for her children's business.

loans.use: To purchase a store in which to operate her cooked rice business and to support her children's business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. is 45 years old. She is a widow with three kids of whom are still in school. To support her household, she started trading palm kernel oil and yams for the past four years. Currently, she buys her supply of palm kernel oil from the local manufacturers and retails them to her customers who include mostly households, food vendors, drivers etc. The sale of yams provides her with additional income to take care of the kids in school.  

With the loan, she hopes to buy Palm kernel oil and yams to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use proceeds from her operation to support her children.  Gladys is a member of the group called Ntoboase. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm kernel oil and yam .

loans.name: Musharifa

texts.ru: Мадрахимова Мушарифа жительница района Вахдат.Возраст 49 лет, замужем ,имеет 3 детей.Образование средне-техническое,по специальности медицинская сестра.Работает в поликлинике,заработная плата очень маленькая поэтому клиентка  занимается животноводством.Она покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их в течении 45 детей и перепродает на рынке,по выгодной ей цене.На доход от своего бизнеса она содержит свою семью.На полученный кредит клиентка хочет купить бычка.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Musharifa M. lives in the Vakhdat region of Tajikistan. She is 49 years old, married and has three children. Musharifa has a technical degree in nursing and works at the local clinic, however her salary as a nurse is very small and she supplements her income by raising cattle. Musharifa purchases calves at the local market, feeds and fattens them for 45 days and then sells the animals at the same market for a higher price. The income from the cattle raising business considerably supplements her income and she supports her family with it. Musharifa wants to use this loan to finance the purchase of another calf. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca Z. is 55 years old. She has three kids who are currently attending school. She trades maize at the local market of Obuasi, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of maize and millet in order to grow her business and increase sales. She says her major difficulty has to do with the kidsa school fees, which she works hard to provide.  She hopes to increase her savings to continue to send her children to school. She hopes that their education will give them better future career opportunities. 

She belongs to the community group called Ntoboase Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee to assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of maize and millet

loans.name: Eshe's Group

texts.en:
Eshe M. is 37 years old and married with three children, ages six, twelve, and thirteen. She has been making and selling dresses in her shop in Zanzibar for 15 years. She also sells juice in the shop. Her business has grown throughout the years and she is now able to earn approximately $250 each month.

Eshe is now looking forward to taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania. She will use the capital to buy more dresses and juices, make changes to her business, and increase the rate of her shop's growth.

Eshe shares this loan with her fellow group members Chichu and Khadija.

loans.use: To buy more dresses and juices for her business.

loans.name: Stelastina

texts.en:
Stelastina A. is 35 years old. She is a wife and mother of four kids. Currently, all her kids are attending school. 

Her food business is the source of her livelihood.  She has been selling yams for seven years to support her family. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supplies. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wishes to buy yams to serve to her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Stelastina is a member of a community group called Ntoboaseâ (meaning patience) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy yams and maize.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Memuna A. has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is a 39 year-old widow with eight kids. Four kids are currently in school but the other four have graduated. 

She is a busy petty trader who sells salt and shea butter at the local market. She also retails kerosene to provide her with additional income. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business in the long-term. With the loan, she wants to add more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. 

She believes the loan will enable her to purchase additional stock to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance. Memuna is a member of the group called Ntoboaseâ. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more salt, shea butter and kerosene.

loans.name: Beti's Group

texts.en:
Beti is 30 years old and married with two children, ages six and eight. She has had a shop in Zanzibar for five years. She works every day from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $80.

Beti is looking forward to taking out her first loan with BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her profit.

Beti shares this loan with her fellow group member, Zabibu.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a 43 year-old divorced mother of four children. Currently, two of the kids are in school and the others have completed school. 

Georgina enjoys selling goods and providing great customer care. She has been selling maize and gari for the past three years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. This helps her avoid spending money on middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. 

She wants to use the loan to buy increased inventories of maize and bags of gari to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids who are ready to enter university this year. Georgina is a member of a community group called the St. John Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize and bags of gari for her food store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. operates a grocery store in her neighborhood. She started her operation three years ago at Dunkwa-obuasi where she lives with her children and her husband. She is a 34 year-old mother with four kids, who are currently in school. 

She trades food producs such as rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. With the loan, she wishes to buy additional cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods, and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of variety, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. 

She would appreciate your assistance very much. She is a member of the group called St. John Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee to provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, cooking spices and tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: 2052 Group

texts.en:
Sharifa has owned a beauty salon in Zanzibar since 2005. She also sells "chipsi", or french fries, on the side. She works every day from 8:00am to 9:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $85. She is happy to be taking out her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can have more products, accomodate more clients, and increase her profit.

Sharifa is 38 years old, divorced, and has five children. Her children range in age from 1 to 19 years old. Sharifa will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Raya and Mtumwa.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua D. is a 26-year-old woman and is married with three kids, who currently attend school. Akosua works very hard to provide food for herself and her children.  She has four years of experience dealing in goods such as ladies bags, shoes, materials and other footwear in a market center at Obuasi Ghana. She believes that with her good human relations and her proximity to the market area, the loan would help her to purchase the right quantity of goods demanded by her loyal customers. She says that this would help her make more profit to expand her business and also finance her kids' education. Akosua is a member of Trust Group called St John. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy more women's shoes, bags, slippers and materials.

loans.name: Salama's Group

texts.en:
This group includes Salama B. from Zanzibar. She is 35 and married with five children, aged nineteen (twins), fifteen, nine, and one. She has been selling charcoal (which is a type of fuel that is commonly used for cooking across Tanzania) for twenty years. She works from 7:00 am - 8:00 pm daily, and currently earns monthly profits of about $80.

This will be Salama's first loan with BRAC. She is hoping to use the loan to buy larger amounts of charcoal in bulk. This will help her sell larger volumes to her customers and make greater profits. Thank you for helping Salama and Mvyuna!

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 28 years old and married with two kids. Her kids are currently in school. To support her family, she has been hawking cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says that selling cosmetics is very lucrative and, therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to sponsor her children's education. Elizabeth is a member of the group called St John. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is 27 years old. She is married and has given birth to two kids. At the moment, the kids are in school. She sells baby clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles etc. through hawking. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to her customers to sell at their door steps. She also sells maize to supplement her income.

She needs the loan to enable her inject more capital into the business to make progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials to increase her stock, in order to make more income to provide her children with a good education. She is a member of the group called St. John Trust Group. In this group, members' guarantee for one another and assist themselves to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and maize

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M., a 33 year old woman, is married with three kids, and a very hard working trader. She enjoys selling cosmetics products, which has been her major source of livelihood for the past four years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. 

At the moment, she does not have a shop so she sells at the community market. Mary believes that with the loan, she will possess sufficient resources to purchase more cosmetics goods and jewelries. She is a member of the St. John Group, where members provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetic products and jewelry

loans.name: 2052 Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Theresiya has been selling dresses in Zanzibar since 2005. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns approximately $45 in profit each month. She is taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania and is looking forward to using it to expand her inventory and increase her profit.

Theresiya is 30 years old, single, and has 3 children, ages 1, 10 and 14. She will be sharing this loan with her group member, Cecilia, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more dresses to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch P. is 33 years old and married to Mr. Nga Sokha, 44; he is a motorcycle taxi driver, earning about $2.50 per day. She has seven children, two of whom are married and five of whom are single and live at home; one is employed by a guest house in Siem Reap Province. Touch breeds pigs to sell in her village. She has been breeding pigs since 2003 and currently earns about $5 per day. Touch needs a loan of $400 so her husband can buy a new motorcycle to help attract customers.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to attract customers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys M. is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. Gladys is very resourceful to her family; she provides food and regularly pays the family's bills. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as used clothing. She sells kenkey in the mornings and switches over to used clothing sales in the afternoon. 

She prepares kenkey with milled maize grains, which are cooked and then fries the fish, which is then flavored with hot pepper. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for all meals of the day: breakfast, lunch and supper. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called Judah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Akosua S. has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is a 36-year-old woman and is married with five kids, who are in school. She is a petty trader, who sells palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc. on top of a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business.

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She says that she would be grateful for your assistance. Akosua is a member of the group called Judah. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is a 36-year-old wife and mother of five children, who are in school. She is a very hard working and resourceful mother. She is a retailer of charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Agnes obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Oboasi and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of charcoal to retail to her customers. She hopes to increase her savings to pay her children's educational fees. She belongs to the community group called Judah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 37 year-old mother of three children. Currently, all the kids are in school. She enjoys providing quality customer care. She has been selling maize and beans for the past thirty years to support her family. Florence treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. By doing this, she avoids middleman costs. 

She wishes to use the loan to buy additional inventories of maize and bags of gari to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support one of her kids, who is ready to enter university this year. Florence is a member of a community group called Judah. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy additional inventories of maize and bags of beans.

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma has a small business in Zanzibar. She works every day from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $85.

Fatma is looking forward to taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania so that she can increase her inventory and expand her business. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, also named Fatma.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to expand her business.

loans.name: Hasina's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of three ladies who live in Zanzibar. They are requesting a loan through BRAC Zanzibar. The group leader, Hasina M., is fifty years old and married with three children. She has been selling fish and firewood since 1999, and currently earns about $50 in monthly profits from her businesses. She is now requesting a loan to buy large quantities of fish and firewood in bulk for her business.

Hasina shares this loan with her fellow group members, Fatma and Nunuu. They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy fish and firewood in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Samoeurn H. is 41 years old and is married with two children. And Her husband, Mr. Chhoun Saoroeun, is 27 years old and works as a farmer, earning about $3 per day. She sells palm wine with food and can earn about $4 per day. They live in Svay At Commune, Pursat Province. For another source of income, Samoeurn needs a loan of $500 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her husband to drive as a taxi. She will use the remainder of the loan to increase the amount of palm wine and food she sells. (Her husband is pictured becuase Samoeurn was not available)

loans.use: To purchase a second hand motorcycle for her husband to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Donah Tumusiimeâ Sgroup

texts.en:
Donah is the leader of this five member group. She is twenty-five years old and married with two children, ages three weeks and five years. Her oldest child is attending school. Donah also takes care of her old mother.

She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, staying in a one-room house with three people. They have no piped water at home but they do have electricity and enough for the family to eat three meals a day.

Donah sells second-hand clothes in the Owino market, one the busiest in Kampala. On average, she can sell to ten people a day. She has been in the business for five years and works seven days a week. Formerly, Donah worked as a tea girl in a restaurant near her home. Her major challenges are the rainy season, seasonality, business taxes, and, sometimes, feeding the family.

Donah has been with MCDT for one and a half years and this is her fourth loan. She aspires to see her business expand so that she can start selling wholesale.

-

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng P. is 34 years old and she is married with two children. She is married to Mr. Phan Pheng, 30, a construction worker who earns about $3 per day. Seng earns about $5 per day farming. Seng and her husband work hard every day to generate income.  For another source of income, Seng needs a loan of $400 to purchase pigs to breed and sell; she will use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to breed and sell, and to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Abdul Hamid

texts.en:
Abdul Hamid is married and he lives with his own family. He is a very honest, hard working and talented man. He works in Kabul and has been working in the same area for more than 20 years. During this time, he has not been able to buy a house for his family and he lives in a rental house. After trying his best, he bought land a month ago and needs some money to build on it.

He applied for an individual loan to start working on his land to build a house for his family. He hopes that after completing the house, he can be more successful in his life. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and hopes that this can be a successful process in his country in the future.

loans.use: To start working on his land to build a house

loans.name: Sengkea

texts.en: Mrs. Sengkea K., 35, is a rice farmer. She has been farming since 1990 and currently earns about $5 per day. She is married to Mr Sorm Sam, 33, a construction worker. Sengkea has three young children. She lives with her family in Svay At Commune, Pursat Province. To improve her farming job that is the main support for her family, she needs a loan of $700 to purchase two buffalos for plowing farmland. The loan will allow her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase two buffalos for plowing farmland

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Savoeurn K. is a 29-year-old rice farmer.  She has been farming since 1990, earning about $5 per day. She is married to Yern Von, 30, a fisherman. Savoeurn has six young children, all of whom are in school.  She spends a lot of time taking care of her family. To improve her farming business, Saveurn needs a loan of 800,000 Riel (US$200) to add to her own money to purchase a pump. She is happy that the loan will allow her to improve her business.

loans.use: To add to her money to purchase a pump

loans.name: Then

texts.en: Mrs. Then C. is a 41-year-old widow. She has one child who is employed as a garment worker and also helps to support Mrs. Then. She is a farmer currently.  In the past, she sold groceries, but stopped for a while because she has been busy with her farming job. Now Mrs. Then would like to return to her grocery business. Hence, Mrs. Then would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase grocery inventory to sell. She hopes the loan will allow her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Faridon

texts.en:
This is Faridon, 32, who lives in Jalalabad city and is married and the father of five children. He has experience in the spare parts business because he is a shopkeeper of five years' experience in Jalalabad city. He also likes body building and he exercises in a club.

Now he needs some money because his expenditures are too great and he needs to buy some things: oil, food, electrical equipment. His income is not enough for his whole household and he has a wish to become a good businessman in the future.

Therefore he has requested to take a 50,000(AF) loan from AFSG for 18 months and he wants to realize his dreams and purchase some oil, food, mobile Simcards, etc. He wants to became a good businessman in the future. And he is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva and to AFSG.

loans.use: buying some oil, food, mobile simcard, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca Nakalema's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is a leader of a five-member group. She is a 24-year-old married woman with two children aged between four and nine, both of whom are in school. She resides and rents a two-room house where she is staying with four other people.

The family gets two meals a day and occasionally take tea. Rebecca resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She is a hard worker who sellsb charcoal in Kasubi, one of the city's suburbs; she has been in this business for over four years. Rebecca sells to an average of 20 people a day. Her monthly expenses include rent for her home and business, and water and electricity bills.

Rebecca has been with MCDT for one year and is servicing her sixth loan .

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business

loans.name: Margaret Nakayizaâ's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a leader of a five-member group. She is a 45-year-old married woman with six children, ages between four and 18 years. All her children go to school. Margaret also takes care of the two children of her late brother. She resides and owns a six-room house where she is staying with eight people.

Margaret resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Margaret sells bedding (bed sheets, blankets, and mattresses). Margaret buys these products directly from factories and sometimes receives free transportation back to her shop. She sells both on wholesale and retail markets.

Margaret has been with MCDT for ten years and is servicing her twelfth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business to help achieve her dream of selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To expand her bedding business

loans.name: Bugolo Zibulatudde Group

texts.en:
Tausi N. is the chairperson of the Bugolo Zibulatudde Group in Kikondo, Lugazi. She is 42 years old and married with six children. She also cares for two children who are not her own. One of the children is an orphan and one is her step-child. They are both in school along with three of her kids.

This is Tausi's second time seeking a loan from Kiva. With the loan, she plans to buy more small fish to sell to her ever increasing customers. She works primarily in the Tororo district.

With the previous loan, she was able to make more profits, which enabled her to pay school fees for her children and buy a piece of land for farming. She would like to buy more land very soon. In her fish selling business, she plans to start selling the same fish to other districts. There is a lot of demand and she believes this will bring in more income. With this loan, she has plans to buy more basins of mukene for sale.

loans.use: Tausi Nabbanja would like to buy more small fish (mukene) for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Martha Namugera's Group

texts.en:
Martha is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 54-year-old widow with eight children, ages between 15 and 33 years. Two of her children are in school and the others are working menial jobs because they didn't get chance to go to school. She resides in and owns an eight-room house where she is staying with twelve people. Martha takes care of three orphans.

Martha resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Martha is a hard-working woman who sells second-hand shoes in Nattette, one or the city's suburbs. She has been in this business for over four years. Martha buys these products from Owino Market and uses public transport back to her business. Martha sells to an average of 20 people a day. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business, plus water and electricity bills.

Martha has been with MCDT for one year and is servicing her second loan; she plans to build rental rooms in the extra space she has available.

loans.use: To expand her second-hand shoe business

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: Nogaye G., 38 ans, mariée, 13 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de NG. NG. depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce de parfum, encens, pagne et acheter des moutons et des aliments de bétail pour faire de l’élevage. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Nogaye G., age 38, is married and has thirteen children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group NG. NG. for five and a half years. She wants to bolster her small-scale commerce in perfumes, incenses, and pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and to buy sheep and the feed for raising them. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in perfumes, incense, pagnes, and livestock

loans.name: Bisabyaba Ahmed's Group, Bugolo

texts.en:
B. Ahmed is a married man with four children who are grown and have their own families, but he takes care of 3 grandchildren whose parents died of AIDS.

B. has been a fisherman all his life; it's the only business he has ever known. He fishes from Kikondo, a landing site in Lugazi, and sells his catch to traders and business people. In a round of fishing, he can catch and sell 20 basins of fish for about $5 each.

Ahmed has his own boat, which he has been using all this time, and he hopes to buy another boat that he can hire out for more income. He is seeking his first loan from Pearl Microfinance so he can improve his business by repairing his fishing net and the lights on his boat.

loans.use: Make repairs to his fishing net and the lights on his boat.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou D., 39 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce  en achetant de l’huile et de la marchandise pour approvisionner une boutique (alimentation). Son souhait est d’augmenter son capital pour faire plus de revenus. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Astou D. is 39 and married with five dependent children. She has been a member of the Mbousnack village council for 6 years. She would like to augment her small retail business by buying some oil and merchandise to stock a small grocery store. She would like to increase her capital in order to increase her revenues. She plans to repay the loan after six months with a single payment.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil and merchandise to stock a small grocery store

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S., 49 ans, veuve, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de niébé, arachide, piment, poivre et cube maggi. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer la prise en charge de sa famille.<b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Fatou S., age 49 , is a widow with six children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Mbousnack for six years. She want to bolster her business selling black-eye peas, peanuts, chili peppers, black pepper, and Maggi bouillon cubes. Her income allows her to ensure her family's expenses are covered. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in food items

loans.name: Mai Astou

texts.fr: Mai Astou S., 51 ans, mariée, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des produits (effets de toilette) pour charger une cantine et renforcer son petit commerce de vente d' arachide, niébé et mil. Ses revenus lui permettent d’acheter du bétail et de renforcer ses stocks.<b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Mai Astou S., age 51, is married and has one child in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group for six years. She wants to buy goods (toiletries) to stock a booth and to enhance her small-scale business selling peanuts, black-eyed peas, and millet. Her income enables her to buy livestock and to bolster her inventories. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell toiletries and food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming products to continue business.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 33 años, vive  con su hija y su esposo. Desde su juventud trabaja en la agricultura y en el comercio de sus productos, por medio de los viajes que realiza, cada semana o cada 15 días, y no solo vende de sus propios productos, sino que también otros que compra. Aydee disfruta diariamente de estas actividades, por ello piensa continuar trabajando de esta forma. Se esfuerza diariamente para poder educar a su hija. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá invertir en la compra de más mercadería, su meta es  tener un local estable en la ciudad para comercializar.
texts.en:
Aydee is 33 years old, and lives with her daughter and her husband. From her youth she has worked in agriculture and in the sale of her products, by means of the travel she has done, each week or every 15 days, and she doesn't only sell her own products, but also others that she buys. Aydee enjoys daily these activities, which is why she continues working this way. She strengthens herself every day to be able to educate her daughter. She is asking for his loan with which she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise, her goal is to have an established location in the city to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in agricultural products to continue her sales

loans.name: Bernandina

texts.es: Bernardina tiene 41 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo, sus 4 hijos y su suegra.  Trabaja cada día para lograr que su familia tenga el sustento diario, se dedica a las diversas tareas del campo, siembra papa y oca, pero intensifica más sus actividades en la crianza de animales, cría cerdos y cuyes. Cuando llegue la época de cosecha la tarea será más ardua, Bernardina y toda su familia participarán, luego la ganancia se verá cuando va con toda su cosecha a los mercados principales de Huancayo a vender, este trabajo que realiza es su forma de vida, heredada de su padres. Su gran motivo es ver a su familia sustentada y sin carencias. Bernardina solicita este préstamo con el que comprará alimento balanceado para sus animales y también un toro pequeño, porque empezará a dedicarse a la venta de animales.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 41 years old. She currently lives with her husband, her four children, and her mother-in-law. She works each and every day so that her family will have daily sustenance. She dedicates herself to various tasks of the countryside, planting potatoes and oca (a type of Andean tuber), but spends most of her efforts on raising animals such as hogs and guinea pigs. When harvest time arrives, her work is more arduous and Bernardina and her whole family participate in the effort. Later, the earnings will be seen when she takes her crops to the major markets in Huancayo to sell. This work that she does is a way of life, inherited from her parents. Her greatest motivation is to see her family well cared for and not lacking anything. Bernardina requests this loan with which she will purchase well-balanced feed for her animals and a small bull, because she also will start selling animals.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of well-balanced feed for her animals as well as a small bull.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 39 años, vive con sus 2 hijas.  Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa en lo que hace, su gran responsabilidad, como sostén único de su hogar, la han llevado a tomar la decisión de  tener un negocio propio donde pueda generarse los recursos económicos, es así, que en su tienda ofrece productos de pan llevar y la atención que ofrece es diaria, en su localidad, la demanda de sus productos es durante la mañana, por las tardes se dedica a ver a sus animales, Pilar quiere continuar con este negocio, porque le permite sostener a sus hijas, además que se siente contenta por ser independiente.  El motivo de su esfuerzo son sus hijas. Pilar solicita ese préstamo que le será de mucha utilidad para incrementar la mercadería de su tienda, ella es muy perseverante y su meta es tener una tienda bien surtida en productos.
texts.en:
Pilar is 30 years old and lives with her two daughters. She is a hard-working woman in everything she does and her great responsibility, as sole support for the household, led her to make the decision to start her own business to earn a living. It’s for this reason that, in her store, she offers many basic needs products and tends to her customers on a daily basis. The demand for her products is during the mornings, and in the afternoons she dedicates herself to caring for her animals. Pilar wants to continue with this business because it allows her to support her children, and because she feels content being independent. The motivation for all her efforts is her daughters. Pilar requests this loan which will be very useful to her to increment the merchandise in her store. She is very perservering and her goal is to have a well-stocked store.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe takku liggeye  regroupe quatre (04) membres dont trois femmes et un homme tout mariés et responsable de famille.Leur actvité principale est le petit commerce  de fruitset legumes mais aussi du poisson frais ou sec dans la banlieu de mbour .Chaque matin ils quittent leurs maisons pour se rendre dans les marchés.Le pret obtenu leur permettra de renforcer leur activité de petit commerce.
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey consists of four members, three women and one man, all of them married and responsible for their families. Their main business is small-scale sales of fruit and vegetables, but also fresh or dried fish on the outskirts of Mbour. Every morning they leave their houses to go to the marketplaces. The loan will allow them to bolster their little businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio inició el negocio para contar con una actividad remunerable como una manera de obtener recursos para mantener a su familia, el empezó con la construcción de casa y fachadas, poco a poco hizo crecer su negocio y actualmente cuenta con tres empleados que le ayudan a realizar los trabajos.

El necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar madera que le hace falta para poder ofrecer otros servicios. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Leoncio started his business to have an paying activity as a way to make money to support his family. He started with the construction of houses and facades and little by little he grew his business and currently has three employees that help him perform his works. He needs a loan of $275 that he will repay in 4 months to buy wood that he needs to be able to offer other services. With your support he will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood for his business

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que su esposo tiene un trabajo poco redituable porque traba jane la construcción y no siempre tiene trabajo, por lo que en ocasiones se complica el poder hacer los pagos de servicios y demás, es por eso que ella decidió vender ropa usada.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar pacas de ropa. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Alicia started her business to support her husband with the household expenses since her husband has as a job is not very profitable because he works in construction and he doesn't always have work, which on occasions complicates being able to pay bills and everything else. For this reason she decided to sell used clothing. She needs a loan of $275 that she will repay in 4 months to buy packages of clothing. With your help she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of packages of clothing

loans.name: Dane Dole Group

texts.fr: Le groupe réuni des hommes et femmes qui depuis plusieurs année font du commerce des céréales leur principale activité génératrice de revenus.A la fin de l'hivernage les prix des céréales sont intressants et c'est moment de constituer des stocks à des prix bas.A cette période del' année le groupe sollicite un pret pour renouveller son stock de céréale.
texts.en:
For several years, this group of men and women have come together to do commerce in grain that is their principal income-generating work. At the end of the hot season, grain prices are cheap, and this is the time to build up a stock at low prices. In this period of the year, the group is requesting a loan to renew its stock of grain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana owns a successful clothing sales business at the central market in Kahovka, Ukraine. She has a small booth in a good, visible location at the market where each day she sets up an attractive clothing display for passing customers. Oksana is divorced. Her business provides an important source of income for her. She currently makes around $1,000 in a typical month.

Oksana has requested a 12-month loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Grivnas to add to her working business capital and help purchase new inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and resulting profits. We believe 20 years of experience working in this sphere of trade, perseverance and commitment will guarantee successful growth of this small venture and prompt repayment of the current loan.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia es casada y tiene 3 hijos: Ángela de 4, Rogelio de 2 y Ana Paola de 1 año. Ella inició el negocio para tener un ingreso más en su hogar y apoyar a su esposo con gastos familiares. Comenzó hace 1 año vendiendo y elaborando tortillas de harina, y poco a poco ha logrado hacerse de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar algo de mobiliario que necesita para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is married and has 3 children: Ángela, 4, Rogelio, 2, and Ana Paola, 1 year old. She started her business in order to supply one more income to her household and support her husband with the family expenses. She started 1 year ago selling and making flour tortillas and little by little she has succeeded in having clients.

She requests a loan of $550, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy some units she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase units for business.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a small entrepreneur from the town of Pavlograd, Eastern Ukraine. She runs a small business selling women's outfits and footwear in the market called Yulana. A married mother of two daughters, she works really hard to keep her business sustainable and running smoothly. Nataliya has been operating it for 14 years. Today she has about $10,000 invested in turnover capital. Nataliya is very happy to have her family help her with the business. She believes their joint efforts make the family business a success.  

Nataliya hopes to develop her business further in the future. She is thinking about purchasing 20 women's suits. Assorted merchandise would facilitate her sales and business activity as a result. Today she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to help her offer a nicer variety of this type of merchandise. One of her long-term plans is to construct a vending kiosk, which would make her working conditions a lot more comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase 20 women's suits

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two grown sons. Ten years ago she decided to start her own small business. She knew that it would require stamina and flexibility, but she decided to take a risk and try it out, strongly believing that she would succeed. Today Olga runs a successful small business selling clothing in the central city market of Melitopol. 

Olga is very serious and determined. Her great entrepreneurial skills and commitment to her business have helped her keep her sales high and costs low. The ability to give her customers what they want plus a little more, such as a smile or a word of encouragement, has helped Olga keep loyal customers who come back over and over again. Currently she has about $2,000 in working capital with a monthly profit of around $600. Olga is requesting a loan for 3,000 Grivnas to increase working capital. We believe her passion for business, enthusiasm in customer service and marketing skills, together with financial assistance, will help Olga expand her trade and develop a strong competitive business. 

Note: This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells clothing, footwear and cooking utensils at Bronibima near Elmina. She is divorced and has three children. Having received a primary school education, Mary has been selling clothing, footwear and cooking utensils since 1996. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing and cooking utensils for resale to her ever-increasing customer base. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and increase operations and sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and cooking utensils for resale

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un apoyo económico extra al de su marido, ya que tiene 4 hijos: Esther de 16 años, Laura de 15 años, Roberto de 13 años, Dalila de 8 años, todos ellos estudian por lo que los gastos se incrementaban y no les alcanzaba el dinero. Ella comenzó hace 5 años vendiendo hamburguesas los fines de semana en casa de su mama, posteriormente decidió rentar un local y vender otro tipo de alimentos diario.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima y ofrecer otra variedad de platillos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Esther started her business out of a necessity to provide extra economic support to her husband since they have 4 children: Esther, 16 years old, Laura, 15 years old, Roberto, 13 years old, and Dalila, who is 8 years old, all of whom are studying which is why their expenses were increasing and lacked money. Five years ago she started selling hamburgers on the weekends in her mother's house, later she decided to rent a location and sell other types of daily foods. She needs a loan of $275 that she will repay in 4 months to buy raw materials to offer a greater variety of dishes to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw material for her food selling business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two grown daughters. She lives in Melitopol and owns a small business in the central city market. A skilled entrepreneur and married mother, Tatyana is dedicated to the growth and the success of her business. For the past six years, she has sold sportswear and footwear in the central market of Melitopol, Ukraine. The blend of an ideal location and skillful product presentation make Tatyana's vending kiosk a point of attraction in the Melitopol market. Her kindness, skill, and outgoing personality have helped her to develop a strong client base. With a strong character and desire to see business growth, Tatyana has maintained a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine for the last 5 years. 

Currently, Tatyana has $2,000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $800. Her monthly net profit is about $400. Today Tatyana is requesting a loan of 3,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory. With the additional income from profits, Tatyana hopes to continue improving her family's standard of living. Moreover, profit generated by her business will give Tatyana a chance to pay for her youngest daughter's education at one of the local colleges.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Fasse Diome Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FASSE DIOME regroupe des hommes et femmes qui ont une longue experience dans le commerce de poissons ,frais, sec ou fumé.Le montant du pret  obtenu servira à renforcer leur activité de commerce.Chaque membre du groupe recevra une somme du pret qu 'il utilisera pour accroitre son commerce.
texts.en:
The FASSE DIOME Group brings together men and women who have lengthy experience in commerce in fresh, dried, or smoked fish. The loan obtained will serve to bolster their businesses. Each member of the group will receive a portion of the loan amount for growing his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wikister

texts.en: Wilkister A. is a 23-year old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu Kenya with her husband and two living children.  Wilkister is a hard working entrepreneur who runs two fruit and vegetable stalls in a busy street in Kisumu.Her hard work, determination and excellent people skills have led to her success. The income generated fro her business is able to support her household expenses. She plans to use three quarters of her loan of US $500 to purchase more stock of fruits in bulk and save a bit of it to use in case of emergencies.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of fruits for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through Junior High.

Emmanuel sells clothing he designs and sews himself. He makes both Ladies and Men's wear at Bronibima, near Elmina. He has been in this business since 2001.

Emmanuel uses his income to pay utility bills and other expenses. He also cares for his aged Mother.

Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials and tools so he can better meet the requests of his ever increasing customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to expand his capital base to increase his productivity.

loans.use: Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials and tools to enable him meet the needs of his customers

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener mas ingreso para ayudar con los gastos a su esposo ya que su hija termino la preparatoria y se fue a estudiar fuera de la ciudad y escogió una carrera que es cara. Comenzó aproximadamente hace 2 años vendiendo artículos decorativos primero solo con las compañeros de la trabajo ya que ella es secretaria, con los familiares y vecinos hasta que fue haciendo mas clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir un pedido de velas aromáticas, cuadros y relojes. Con tu ayuda ella hará crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Evangelina started her business out of necessity to gain more income to help her husband with the household expenses since their daughter finished her pre-university studies and went to study away from home in a degree program that is very expensive. About 2 years ago she started selling decorative articles, first only to her work colleagues, since she is a secretary, and to her family and neighbors, until she started gaining more clients. She needs a loan of $400 that he will pay 6 months to supply a request for aromatic candles, paintings and watches. With your help she will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena O. is married and has one child. He has received schooling through the junior high level. His wife is a fishmonger.

Kwabena makes artifacts and crafts and sells them at Coconut Grove near Elmina. He has been in this business since 2003. Kwabena uses his income to pay his utility bills and other family expenses.

Kwabena will use this loan to purchase carving tools, wood, and other materials for his business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwabena plans to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase carving tools, wood, and other materials

loans.name: Enedelia

texts.es:
Enedelia inició el negocio para obtener otros ingresos para salir adelante y poder darles educación a sus hijos, inicio vendiendo zapatos por catalogo primero a sus vecinos y familiares para solventar el gasto de su hogar y después fue incrementando sus clientes logrando obtener mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $625 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mas inventario. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Enedelia started her business to gain more incomes to get ahead and to be able to provide an education for her children. She started selling shoes via catalog, first to her neighbors and friends to cover her household expenses and then began increasing the number of customers to obtain more income. She needs a loan of $625 that she will repay in 6 months to purchase merchandise and have more inventory. With your support she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse merchandise for her shoe selling business

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.

Justa es casada, tiene 56 años y 7 hijos, Justa junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en su casa que se ubica al frente del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, cereales enteros y molidos, sus ventas son al por mayor y menor para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de un empleado, sus productos los adquiere de las feriantes y también de distribuidores que le traen a su negocio. Actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana.

Justa necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, harina. Justa sueña con tener una empresa en donde tengan participación todos sus hijos, que el ultimo de sus hijos culmine sus estudios universitarios y descansar, disfrutar de unas buenas vacaciones.
texts.en:
Justa is a partner in the Alborada community bank.

She is 56 years old and is marries with 7 children. Justa and her husband have a store in their home, which is located in front of the market in the city of Ayacucho, where they sell groceries as well as whole and ground grains. She sells her products in both large and small amounts, and she has one employee. She purchases her products from wholesalers and from distributors who visit her store. She is open 7 days a week.

Justa is requesting a loan of 3000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and flour. She dreams of having a company where her children can work, to have her children finish their university studies, and to rest and enjoy a nice vacation.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Justa is requesting a loan of 3000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.

Julia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hija de 19 años, Julia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en una calle céntrica y cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende útiles de escritorio, mercerías como betunes, cepillos, juguetes, actividades que realiza con su esposo, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y en algunas oportunidades de distribuidores locales. Además Julia en época escolar viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región llevando útiles escolares, libros. También Julia vende ropa en el mercado 12 de abril, este negocio es atendido por su hija.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes variados, cepillos, betún. Los sueños de Julia son tener un capital propio, su negocio prospere y que su hija culmine sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Julia is a partner iin the Alborada Community Bank.

She 49 years old and is married with a 19 year old daughter. Julia has a store in a rented location on a main street near the central market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells school supplies, shoe polish, brushes, and toys together with her husband. She purchases her products in the city of Lima and occasionally from local distributors. During the school year Julia also travels to different markets in the region to sell school supplies and books. She also sells clothing in the 12 de abril market through a business run by her daughter.

Julia is requesting a loan of 1250 soles which she will use to purchase various toys, brushes, and shoe polish. Her dream is to maintain her own capital, have a prosperous business, and to see her daughter finish her university education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia is requesting a loan of 1250 soles which she will use to purchase various toys, brushes, and shoe polish.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.

Victoria es madre soltera, tiene 51 años y 2 hijos, Victoria se dedica a la venta de productos Omnilife que son medicamentos naturales, vitaminas que son mexicanos, sus ventas son mediante catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares, instituciones. Además Victoria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ubicado en una calle céntrica, este negocio esta administrado por su hermana.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos omnilife. Los sueños de Victoria son educar a sus hijos, incrementar su negocio y realizar los acabados de su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner in the Alborada community bank.

She is a 51 year old single mother with two children. Victoria works selling Omnilife naturalpathic products and Mexican vitamins. She sells her products through catalogs to friends, family and institutions. Victoria also has a small grocery store in her home which is located on a central street. She runs that business with her sister.

Victoria is requesting a 1250 sol loan which she will invest in the purchase of Omnilife products. Her dreams are to obtain an education for her children, to grow her business, and to do the finish work on her home.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria is requesting a 1250 sol loan which she will invest in the purchase of Omnilife products.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina F. se dedica al negocio de venta de cosméticos el cual atiende muy amablemente en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Inició su negocio ofertando pocos productos pero a medida que se ha venido desarrollando ha logrado mejorar su negocio y esto gracias al apoyo de los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel por lo que los ha sabido administrar muy bien. Hoy en día la necesidad que ella atraviesa es la ausencia de dinero para la compra de la mercadería. Por esta razón es que una vez más ella busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Cristina F. has her own cosmetics business, which she kindly manages in her home in the municipality of Sandino City.

She started out by selling only a few products, but as the business has developed, she has managed to improve it thanks to the support in the form of loans that Ceprodel has given her. Because of their support, she has been able to manage her business very well. However, she is now experiencing the lack of funds needed to purchase merchandise. For this reason, she is once again seeking the support of Ceprodel in order stay in business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Gloria Maruja

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada. Gloria es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Gloria vende ropa en un puesto propio ubicado en el mercado 12 de abril, actividad que aprendió de sus padres desde muy pequeña, también viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región y a las fiestas de los distritos en donde hay mayor demanda, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada 15 días.

Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, chompas, casacas, medias. Los sueños de Gloria son sacar adelante a sus hijos con una buena educación, tener una tienda estable, arreglar su casa e implementar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a partner in the Alborada Communal Bank. She is 32 years old, and loves with her 3 children and their father. Gloria sells clothing at a stand located in the 12 de abril market. She has worked selling clothing in the market since she helped her parents as a child. She also travels to different regional fairs, and to parties in various neighborhoods where there is greater demand. She purchases her products in the city of Lima, where she travels every two weeks.

Gloria is requesting a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of shirts, sweaters, jackets, and stockings. Gloria hopes to help her children progress by getting them a good education, to have a stable business, and to fix her house and open another business.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gloria is requesting a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of shirts, sweaters, jackets, and stockings

loans.name: Sope Sa Jakeur Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SOPE SA JAKEUR est un  regroupement de quatre (04) femmes  mariées habiatant la banlieu de mbour .Elle ménent des activités de petit commerce de produits divers céréale, poisson, fruits et legumes depuis plusieurs années .ces activités leur permettent avec les revenus obtenus d'entretenir leurs enfants  en payant leurs frais de scolarité et leurs frais medicaux elles participent ainsi aux dépenses du foyer.Le montant du pret obtenu leur permettera de renforcer leur commerce.
texts.en:
The Sope Sa Jakeur group consists of 4 married people who live on the outskirts of Mbour. They have been selling (on a small scale) various cereals, fish, fruit and vegetables for several years. These businesses allow them to support their children and pay their school fees and medical fees. In this fashion they participate in covering household expenses. The loan will allow them to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marisol, Delfina Y Olga Group

texts.es:
Marisol, Delfina y Olga son socias del Banco Comunal Alborada.
