Marisol es madre soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Marisol tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, que se ubica en una calle céntrica y es alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con 2 empleadas.

Por otro lado Delfina es madre soltera, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Delfina viaja a los diferentes pueblos de la región en donde compra quesos, cereales que luego lo vende de casa en casa al crédito y contado.

Mientras que Olga es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Olga se dedica a la elaboración de panes variados, actividad que realiza en el horno de su mama, sus ventas lo realiza a las tiendas, además Olga tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Marisol, Delfina y Olga necesitan prestamos de 900 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles respectivamente dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas, quesos, cereales, harina. Los sueños de Marisol, Delfina y Olga son tener un taller mas grande en el centro de la ciudad, construir su casa, tener un horno propio y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marisol, Delfina and Olga are partners in the Alborada community bank. Marisol is a 26 year old single mother with one son. She has a dress making shop which she rents on a main street where she employs two women.

Dlefina is a 49 year old single mother with three children. She travels to different areas in the region to purchase cheese and grain which she later sells door to door, for cash or credit.

Olga is a 32 year old woman with 4 children. She works baking different kinds of bread using her mother's oven. Her bread is sold in local stores, and in a small grocery story that Olga has in her home.

Marisol, Delfina and Olga are requesting loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles respectively which they will use to purchase cloth, cheese, grains, and flour. Their dreams are to have a larger shop, to build a house, to purchase an oven and provide their children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marisol, Delfina and Olga are requesting loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles respectively which they will use to purchase cloth, cheese, grains, and flour.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en:
Teodosia R. D. A. is a member of a community bank, Alborada, which means "dawn" in Spanish. She lives with her husband and three children in Ayacucho, Peru. You can find Teodosia working daily in one of the largest markets in Ayacucho. She sells children's clothing and travels monthly to Lima to buy more stock for her business.

She will invest her loan of 1,250 soles in her business and use it to pay her travel expenses to Lima and to other fairs, where she will also sell clothes. She will also use the loan to purchase children's clothing in sizes 0-14. Teodosia's goal is to improve her house by decorating it and building separate rooms for her three children, two of whom are over 18. She hopes to continue moving forward and build up her business.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing for resale and pay for business trips

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex K. is married and has 2 children. He has received a junior high education. He is responsible for paying utility bills and other family expenses.

Alex sells used clothing at Bronibima near Elmina. He has been selling used clothing since 2005, and his wife also sells clothing.

Alex will use this loan to increase his capital to buy used clothing in larger quantities for resale. He hopes to invest the new profits into the business to increase sales, which will in turn increase his income.

loans.use: To buy used clothing in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa Z. D. is a single mother with two children, aged 22 and 23, living in Ayacucho, Peru. She is a member of the community bank, Alborada, which means “dawn” in Spanish. Rosa can be found selling children’s clothing in the market on Jr. 12 de abril in Ayacucho. She travels monthly to Lima to purchase inventory for her business.

Her loan of 1500 soles will be invested in her business by purchasing pants, button-up women’s sweaters, workout clothing and jackets to sell. Her goals are to continue improving her business and to ensure her children become professionals.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza inicio el negocio para tener un ingreso mas además del de su esposo para solventar los gastos familiares de sus 2 hijos de 16 y 12 años y poder ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y obtener mas clientes en las colonias de la zona.
texts.en:
Esperanza started her business to have an income source in addition to her husband's in order to pay the household expenses of their 2 children of 16 and 12 years of age and to be able to offer them a higher quality of life. She works selling cosmetics. She needs a loan of $250 that she will repay in 3 months to purchase merchandise and obtain more customers in various neighborhoods in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Noel De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Estelí del bello país de Nicaragua, el caballero Noel B. desde su su niñez se ha dedicado al negocio de agricultura en su municipio y hoy en día ha atravesado necesidades grandes como lo son el brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos.

Para esto al ver la necesidad de que en la zona donde él habita no se cuenta con energía eléctrica por ser una zona alejada, ha decidido comprar un panel solar para su iluminación y además para que sus hijos estudien por las tardes sin ningún problema. Para esto ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener un crédito que le permita la compra del panel y así continuar mejorando la condición de vida de su amada familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Esteli in the beautiful country of Nicaragua, the gentleman Noel Blandon has been devoted to the business of agriculture in his town since he was young and today has taken on major needs such as providing better living conditions to his family, composed of his wife and their two children. He saw the need in the area where he lives, which does not have electricity because it is a remote area. He has decided to buy a solar panel for lighting and also so their children can study in the evenings without any problems. For this he has sought support from Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan that allows him to purchase the panel and continue to improve the living conditions of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for a solar panel

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
Maria Elsa S. es una comerciante qeu se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras teniendo su propio establecimiento en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Estelí de donde es originaria.

Con la necesidad de mantener a sus dos hijos por requerir el apoyo de su madre, se ha esforzado cabalmente en la venta de sus productos para obtener mejores ingresos y así mejorar la situación de su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Por esta razón es que hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar las frutas y verduras y así ofrecerlas en el mercado de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Elsa Maria S. is a trader dedicated to selling fruit and vegetables and has her own establishment in the municipal market in the city of Esteli where she is from. With the need to support her two children who require the support of their mother, she has worked fully selling her products to obtain better income and thus improve the situation of her family that requires her support. For this reason she has sought support from Ceprodel to obtain credit with which to buy fruit and vegetables to offer them in the market of her community.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria Q. C. lives in Ayacucho with her 12-year-old son. She is part of the community bank, Alborada, which means "daybreak" in Spanish. Victoria can be found daily at the market in Huamanga selling women's clothing. She travels to Lima monthly to keep her stock up to date.

She will use her loan of 1000 soles to pay for traveling expenses and to purchase women's tops, underwear, and bras. Victoria's dream is to have her own store in the mall that is under construction and will open next year. She also dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To pay for travel expenses and purchase women's tops, underwear, and bras.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Estelí, la señora María Isabel B. se dedica al negocio de agricultura sembrando papas las cuales una vez que se da la cosecha ella la levanta y la almacena en grandes sacos para luego comercializarlos en su municipio.

La señora María Isabel hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de obtener el recurso financiero para la compra de insumos para los cultivos de papa y por este motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito oportuno que le permita dicha inversión. Es necesario destacar que ella tiene la tarea de mantener a su anciana madre y además debe de mantenerse en buena salud debido a que pronto será madre de un pequeño bebé. Por este motivo es que espera que su solicitud sea aprobada y así obtener el crédito para invertir en el negocio de siembra de papas y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su mamá y de su pequeño bebé que pronto nacerá.
texts.en:
In the city of Esteli, Mrs Maria Isabel Blandon is dedicated to the business of agriculture, planting potatoes which once they have been harvested she takes them and stores them in large bags to sell in her municipality.

Nowadays, Mrs Maria Isabel is experiencing the need to obtain financial resources to purchase items for the potato crops and that is why she is going to Ceprodel to get the appropriate credit that allows for this investment. It should be noted that she has the responsibility for taking care of her elderly mother and also to keep in good health because she will soon be the mother of a small baby. For this reason she hopes her application is approved, and thus get credit for investing in the business of planting potatoes and continue with taking care of her mother and her little baby who will be born soon.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of items for potato crop

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
Maria Isabel Q. Ramirez lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their five children, ages 5 to 16. Maria Isabel is a member of the community bank, Alborada, which means "daybreak" in Spanish. Maria has her own business selling women's cosmetics from her house. When she has time, she also washes clothes and cooks in her cousin's restaurant when she needs help.

With her loan of 1000 soles, she will invest in her business by purchasing the latest cosmetics for her clients, including eye shadow, eye liner, blush, and lipstick. She has catalogues that she distributes to friends, family members, and members of her community bank. When she receives orders, she has the products sent to her from Lima. Maria Isabel dreams of having her own business in the new mall slated for construction next year in Ayacucho. She also would like to build and own a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha F. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Since 2000, Agatha has been buying rice, sugar, gari, and other food items in bulk, bringing them to her house, and then measuring them into smaller, more affordable quantities to sell to her customers. Her business is doing well at Bronibima near Elmina. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills.

Agatha is requesting a loan to increase her capital to buy the food items she sells in larger quantities. She plans to reinvest her new profits into the business to increase sales and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: To buy food items in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miriam del Socorro se dedica a la labor de venta de queso en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Estelí. Es muy visitada por muchos clientes por la razón de que vende gran variedad de quesos a gusto de sus clientes.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la señora Miriam atraviesa la necesidad de obtener el recurso económico para la compra del queso y por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra del producto para comercializarlo. Actualmente se ha perfilado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel ya que anteriormente ha tenido tres créditos los cuales todos han sido pagados satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Miriam del Socorro is dedicated to the work of selling cheese in her home in the city of Esteli. It is visited by many customers because she sells a large variety of cheeses enjoyed by her customers. Like any developing businesses, Ms. Miriam experiences the need to obtain economic resources for the purchase of cheese and for this reason she is seeking support from Ceprodel to get a loan that allows her to purchase product to market and sell. To this day she has been a faithful client of Ceprodel; she has previously had three loans, all of which have been paid off satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Mr D.  est un jeune commerçant agé d'une vingtaine d 'années.IL gére une boutique où il vend des téléphones portables et des accessoires de téléphones.Le marché des téléphones portable est marché tres devellopé surtout en fin d 'année.Avec le pret Mr D. renforcerason commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. D. is a young businessman of around 20. He manages a shop where he sells cell phones and phone accessories. Cell phone merchants do a lot of business, especially around the end-of-year holidays. With the loan, Mr. D. will bolster his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Señor De La Picota Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor D. la Picota es un Banco Nuevo que recién inicia con 14 socias, quienes después D. semanas D. capacitación inician con mucha alegría. Muchas D. ellas fueron invitadas por socias D. otros Banco Comunales grandes y por la promotora. Las socias viven en el Barrio del Cerro la Picota que se ubica en los falderios del cerro del mismo nombre.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. leña, abarrotes, cereales, ropa, quesos, comida, artesanías, vinos, fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales, tejido D. chompas y reciclaje.

Cada socia tiene una historia diferente como es el caso D. Lucy que se dedica a brindar el servicio D. preparación D. comida para eventos, compromisos familiares, además teje chompas a mano dependiendo D. los pedidos que tenga.

Por otro lado, Zoila venD. vinos y tamales que adquiere en la ciudad D. Cañete D. donD. es natural, pero vive en la ciudad D. Ayacucho hace muchos años, sus ventas los realiza D. casa en casa.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 7,650 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. lanas, polos, quesos, trigo, cebada, maiz, arrroz, mantas, materiales D. reciclaje, lanas y leña. Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, ampliar sus negocios, tener otros negocios mas y local propio.
texts.en:
The Community Banking Group, Señor D. la Picota, is a new bank that recently initiated 14 members, and who after weeks of training, is very happy to be starting out. Many of them were invited by members of other large Community Banking Groups and by the organizer. The members live in the Cerro la Picota neighborhood which is located at the base of the hill of the same name.

The members have different businesses like; selling kindling, general merchandise, grains, clothes, cheese, food, native arts & crafts, wines, bricks maD. by craftsmen, knitted sweaters, and recycling.

Each member has a different story. Like the case of Lucy - who offers food-preparation services for events and family engagements. In addition, she knits sweaters by hand, depending upon the requests that she has.

On the other hand, Zoila sells wines and tamales that she gets from the city of Cañete; which is where she's from, but she's lived in the city of Ayacucho for many years. She sells door to door.

Members need different amounts of loans; amounts such as 300, 450 and 600 soles for a total of 7,650 soles of loans for the Banking Community Group. They will invest the money in the purchase of wool, shirts, cheeses, wheat, barley, corn, rice, blankets, recycled material, and kindling. The dreams of the members are to have their children become professionals, to have their own homes, to grow their businesses, to have additional businesses and their own stores.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Members need different amounts of loans; amounts such as 300, 450 and 600 soles for a total of 7,650 soles of loans for the Banking Community Group.

loans.name: Fusana

texts.en:
Fusana Y. is married and has 4 children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a fisherman.

Fusana buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to be sold at the market at Elmina. She has been in this business since 2000. Fusana uses her income to help her husband pay the children's school fees and the utility bills.

Fusana will use this loan to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fusana plans to save for a piece of land she wants to buy with her husband.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Karla Del Socorro

texts.es:
Karla C. es una esforzada dama originaria de la ciudad de Estelí el cual se dedica a su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos. Es una dama que ha venido desarrollando su negocio de comidería por la razón de que prepara excelentes platillos que cada día atraen a mas clientes.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su desarrollo porque le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha invertido directamente en la compra de su material prima para elaborar los alimentos. Por esto es que una vez más espera obtener un nuevo crédito para la compra de la materia prima y así continuar preparando los deliciosos platillos que tanto atraen a los clientes.
texts.en:
Karla C. is a strong lady originally from the city of Esteli who is dedicated to her business of preparing and selling food. She is a lady who has been developing her food business because she prepares excellent dishes every day to attract more customers. Ceprodel has been a pillar in her development because she has benefited from loans that have been invested directly in the purchase of raw goods to produce food. Because of this she hopes to obtain a new loan to purchase ingredients and continue to prepare delicious dishes that appeal to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella B. is married and has five children. She has received schooling through junior high and now sells fried plantain and special kind of doughnut which is loved by many and it is popularly known as "Bofrot" at Bronibima near Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a receptionist the University of Cape Coast. Stella uses her income to help pay for her children's school fees and other utility bills. Stella will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more maize, sugar and other ingredients to produce more food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to purchase cement and other building materials for the construction of their family's house.

loans.use: To buy more maize, sugar and other ingredients to produce more food

loans.name: Elena Paricia

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble, es separada y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 18 años. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, ha trabajado siempre en este negocio. Ella vende su misma mercadería y la distribuye. Elena desde que recibe los préstamos ha mejorado, ha invertido y tiene mas mercaderia para vender.

Elena necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de las frutas de la selva. Elena sueña con poder hacer estudiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the community banking group - El Roble. She's separated and has 2 children - 19 and 18 years old. She sells fruit for a living and has always worked in this business. She sells her own merchandise and distributes it. Since Elena has been receiving loans, she has improved and invested and now, has more merchandise to sell.

Elena needs a loan of 800 soles - money that will be invested in the purchase of fruit from the forest. Elena dreams of being able to provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elena needs a loan of 800 soles - money that will be invested in the purchase of fruit from the forest.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble. Rosario es soltera y tiene 1 hija de 34 años.
Rosario tiene su negocio de venta de plásticos, empezó hace 3 años vendiendo con una amiga. Ahora ella vende afuera del mercado, desde que recibe los préstamos tiene un capital para su negocio. 
Rosario necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de su mercadería (plásticos, bolsas).   
Rosario sueña con poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the community banking group - El Roble. Rosario is single and has one daughter who's 34 years old. Rosario's business is selling plastic containers - she started the business 3 years ago with a friend. Now she sells outside of the market. Since she's been receiving loans, she has the capital for her business. Rosario needs a loan of 400 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise (plastic containers and purses/bags). Rosario dream of being able to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosario needs a loan of 400 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise (plastic containers and purses/bags).

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
María de la luz inició el negocio para ayudar a su familia y superarse. Ante la falta de recursos económicos, tuvo que dar un paso para ser independiente y asi trabajar por su cuenta ya que lo único que sabia hacer era tomar fotografías pero a no era fotógrafa profesional sino empírica, poco a poco con la practica fue mejorando y tomo mas practica logrando establecerse en diversas ferias ofreciendo su servicio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $850 que pagara en 6 meses ya que quiere empezar a tomar fotografía profesional en su casa con un jardín artificial así como comprar un impresora mas grande para las fotografías profesionales,
texts.en:
María de la luz started her business to help her family succeed. Given the lack of economic resources, she had to take a step to be independent and work on her own. The only thing she knew how to do was to take photographs, but she wasn't a professional photographer and only had informal training, but little by little with practice she was improving and with more practice she was able to establish herself in various fairs offering her service. She needs a loan of US $850 to be repaid in 6 months because she wants to begin taking professional photography in her house with an artificial garden and buy a bigger printer for the professional photographs.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bigger printer

loans.name: Gladys Clara

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 24 y 19 años. Gladys tiene su negocio de venta de todo lo que es ropa interior (pijamas, sabanas, edredones), empezó hace 15 años, ella entrega pedidos.

Gladys necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de su mercadería y asi incrementar su negocio. Gladys sueña con poner su negocio propio, tener su bodega y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the community banking group - El Roble. She's married and has two children; 24 and 19 years old. Gladys sells intimates (pajamas, sheets, down comforters). She began the business 15 years ago and she delivers orders.

Gladys needs a loan of 400 soles - money that will be invested in the purchase of mO. merchandise so she can grow her business. Gladys dreams of having her own business, to have a stO. and buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gladys needs a loan of 400 soles - money that will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise.

loans.name: Denys Verónica

texts.es:
Denys es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos pequeños de 6 años y 7 meses. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, este negocio le ayuda a obtener ingresos, y lo inició hace 1 año con la ayuda de los prestamos incrementa su mercadería.

Denys necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa. Denys sueña con tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Denys is a member of the “El Roble” Communal Bank, is married, and has 2 small children ages 6 years old and 7 months. Her business is selling clothing. This business helps her obtain income, and she began it 1 year ago with the help of loans she increases her inventory. Denys needs a loan of 400 soles which will be invested in the purchase of clothing. Denys dreams of having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cothing

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: La quarantaine dépassée,maguette est commerçant ambualant marié et pere de plusieurs enfants.Chaque matin,il arpante les rues de la ville de mbour pour vendre des vétements de fripperie .Il fait ce travail depuis plusieurs années sans aucun soutien ,avec le pret,il va renforcer son activité .
texts.en:
Now in his 40's, Maguette is a traveling merchant. He is married and the father of several children. Each morning, he walks up and down the city streets of Mbour to sell second-hand clothing. He has been doing this work for several years without any support at all. With this loan, he is going to bolster his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Diana Yazmin

texts.es:
Diana inicio el negocio para tener algo extra ya que el sueldo de su esposo era poco y no les alcanzaba para solventar los gastos de su pequeño hijo de 3 años. Ella empezó con la elaboración y venta de tacos y le ha ido bien hasta la fecha, ya que tiene muy buen sazón y tiene muchos clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana started her business to have extra money since her husband's wages weren't enough to cover all of the expenses of their young 3-year-old son. She started making and selling tacos, and it has gone well for her so far, since they taste very good and she has a lot of customers.

She needs a loan of $400, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase supplies and to be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Don Miguel tiene 59 años de edad, habita en el barrio Batahola Norte, es casado, y tiene cuatro hijos, tres mujeres y un varón ya casados e independiente, su esposa trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud, desempeñañdose como enfermera, y ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Don Miguel vende puros, él los compra al por mayor y luego los empaca en cantidades más pequeñas, tiene cinco años de experiencia, e inició con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima de puro para vender más y obtener más ganancia. A futuro es trabajar con pedidos grandes y exportación,  y mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Don Miguel is 59 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Batahola Norte. He is married and has 4 children, 3 daughters still at home , and one son who is married and independent. His wife works at the ministry of health as a nurse, and her income helps with their household expenses. Don Miguel has a retail business - but he buys wholesale and then sells in smaller quantities. He now has 5 years of experience in this business which he started with his own money. With the loan he is requesting, he will purchase more merchandise needed to grow his business and increase his income. In the future he would like to be able to fill large orders and export his products, improving the quality of life for his family.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business and continue to improve the quality of life for his family

loans.name: Benedicto Berly

texts.es:
Benedicto es socio del Banco Comunal El Roble, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 5 años. El ultimo niño esta en jardín. Benedicto maneja un mototaxi que adquirió hace 5 años, desde entonces el utiliza sus prestamos en su negocio para arreglar y darle mantenimiento a su medio de transporte, muy popular en la zona donde él vive.

Benedicto necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de su moto. Benedicto sueña con poner su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Benedicto is a member of "Banco Comunal El Roble", he is married and has two children, 10 and 5 years old. The youngest is in Kindergarden. Benedicto drives a motorcycle taxi which he got 5 years ago. Since then he has used his business loans to fix and maintain his means of tranportation, which is very popular in the area where he lives.

Benedicto needs a loan of 400 soles to be invested in maintenance of his motorcycle. Benedicto dreams of setting up his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be invested in maintenance of motorcycle.

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es:
Lisseth es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos pequeños de 5 y 4 años.
Lisseth tiene su negocio de comida, vende menús, empezó hace 6 meses con este negocio, ella reparte comida a los obreros de la zona. El negocio es durante el día por eso Lisseth esta planificando tener otro negocio por las noches que es la venta de Cd´s.
Lisseth necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en un nuevo negocio, quiere dedicarse a vender cd´s por las noches.   
Lisseth sueña con aumentar su negocio y poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
Lisseth is a member of the communal bank El Roble. She lives with her partner and has two small children ages five and four.

Lisseth has a business selling meals. She started this business six months ago. She delivers food to workers in her neighborhood. Because she works during the day she is planning on having another business in the evenings selling cds.

Lisseth needs a loan in the amount of $ 150 which she will invest in starting her new business selling cds. Lisseth dreams with increasing her business and starting a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in starting a new business selling cds.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana B. is a single parent with one child. She has received schooling through the Junior High level. Since 2003, Julianer has sold baby clothing at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Juliana uses her income to pay for the family's financial needs and to care for her child. Juliana will use the loan to purchase baby clothing to meet the increase in demand because the stock she is able to purchase with her capital is not enough to meet this demand She is, therefore, asking for a loan that will enable her to buy more baby clothing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to reinvest into her business to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy baby clothing

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo inició el negocio por que sus hijos no tenían dinero para seguir estudiando y su esposa tiene leucemia por lo cual necesita de tratamientos muy caros para su rehabilitación, siendo esta la causa de iniciar con la elaboración y venta de tacos, con la ayuda de sus 2 cuñados. Comenzó hace 3 años con la ayuda de sus cuñados ya que ellos también necesitaban dinero para sacar adelante sus estudios, se inicio en una esquina cerca de su casa con la venta de tacos nada pero conforme fue pasando el tiempo los mismos clientes pidieron que se vendiera tortas y fue así como poco a poco fueron saliendo adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para poder hacer crecer mas su negocio, planea modificar su carreta para darles un mejor trato a sus clientes y así tener mayores ganancias para seguir adelante con su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Alfredo started the business because his children did not have enough money to continue their studies, and because his wife has leukemia which requires very expensive treatments. These were the reasons why he started making and selling tacos, with the help of his two brother-in-laws. He started three years ago with their help, as they also needed money for their educations, on a corner near his home. As time passed, his regular customers starting asking for tortas and little by little they began getting ahead.

He needs a loan of $400 USD, which he will repay in six months, in order to make his business grow. He plans to modify his cart so he can provide a better level of service to his customers and increase his profits, so he can continue getting ahead along with his wife and children.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make modifications to his food sales cart.

loans.name: Papa Gueye

texts.fr:
C'est un jeune commerçant demeurant à Thiadiaye. il a adhéré à la caisse depuis fevrier 2004 et il n'a jamais bénéficié de crédit. c'est un grand travailleur et il s'active dans la vente des produits cosmétique et dans la vente des chaussures comme activité acessoire.

il va utiliser l'argent pour renforcer le niveau de ses marchandises et praparer ainsi les prochaines fetes.
texts.en:
This young merchant lives in Thiadiaye. He has belonged to the bank since February 2004 and he has never taken out a small loan. He's a hard worker, selling cosmetics and secondarily, shoes.

He is going to use the loan to bolster his inventory so as to be prepared for the coming holiday season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering his working capital

loans.name: George

texts.en: George K. is a single parent with two children. He has received schooling through the Senior High level. George sells phones and accessories at the Siwdo compound near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2007. George uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and other family expenses. George will use the loan to purchase the latest mobile phones and their accessories. With the new profits from his expanded business, George plans to reinvest in his business so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina inició el negocio porque siempre le gustaron las ventas, pero cuando se caso se dedico a sus hijos y dejo de trabajar, pero cuando crecieron le quedaba mucho tiempo libre, además de que las comisiones que le ofrecían por vender dichos productos eran atractivas. Comenzó en el mes de Marzo de 1999, vendiendo primeramente entre sus vecinas y amistades, y ellas mismas la fueron recomendando con otras personas y así fue progresando y en la actualidad ya cuenta con un buen número de clientes. También dentro de la organización ha ido escalando niveles y ahora además de vender los productos esta capacitada para dar cursos de cosmetología y cuidado del cuerpo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes en esta época cercana de fin de año y seguirles brindando una buena atención que le permita conservarlos.
texts.en:
Guillermina began her business because she always liked sales, but when she got married she quit working to take care of her children. When they grew up, she had free time. And the commissions offered for the products were attractive. She began in the month of March in 1999 selling mostly to her neighbors and friends. They recommended her to other people and that is how she advanced and now she has a good number of clients. Also, within the organization she has been rising through the levels and now in addition to selling products she is also trained to give classes in cosmetology and body care. She needs a loan of $925.00, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can fill the orders from her customers, since it is near the time of the year-end holidays, and provide them with the good service that will allow her to keep them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es: La señora Julia Estela P. Ampie, tiene la edad de 44 años habita en Ticuantepe; esta señora es  madre soltera  tiene  a su cargo 2 hijas que actualmente estudian su secundaria en el instituto de Ticuantepe. Esta señora tiene una pulpería ubicada en su vivienda y tiene por nombre pulpería P.. Esta señora también trabaja como operaria en una zona franca para poder ayudarse con los gastos de la casa, sus hija le ayudan con la pulpería ya que una va a clase por la mañana y la otra por la tarde, el mayor sueño de doña Julia es darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijas por lo cual decidió pedir un préstamo para incrementar su negocio y obtener mejores ganancia.
texts.en:
Julia Estela Perez is 44 years old and lives in Ticuantepe. She is a single mother who cares for 2 daughters who attend highschool. Julia runs a small general store from her home. She also works in a duty free shop to help cover the household costs. Her daughters help her with the business, as one goes to class in the morning and the other goes in the afternoon. Julia's dream is to be able to provide a better quality of life for her children, which is why she is requesting the loan to grow her business and increase her income.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small general store, increase her income, and provide a better quality of life for her two daughters.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. était président d'un groupe de crédit ui a bénéficié de plusieurs crédits soldés sans problemes. Elle a ouvert son compte individuel et s'active dans le petit commerce de fruits et de légumes frais dans le quartier ou elle habite à Thiadiaye. c'est une femme trés dynamique qui mérite d'etre accompagnée.
texts.en:
Fatou S. has been the president of a loan group, which has benefited from several loans that have been settled without problems. She opened her own individual account and is active in small-scale commerce in fresh fruit and vegetables in the district where she lives in Thiadiaye. This is a very energetic woman who deserves to be supported.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Amada inició el negocio porque deseaba apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos, ya que quería darles una mejor calidad de vida, además de que también ayuda a su mamá con los gastos. Comenzó el mes de Agosto de 2000, cuando la invitaron a vender cosméticos y le pareció buena idea ya que le permitía organizar su tiempo sin descuidar a la familia, fue así que empezó vendiendo entre sus vecinas y amistades, después casa por casa. En la actualidad cuenta con un diploma por altas ventas y es candidata a Directora.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses para cubrir las necesidades de productos de sus clientes y seguir conservándolos para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Amada started the business because she wanted to support her husband with the household and child-related expenses, since she wanted to provide a higher standard of living for them. In addition, she also helps her mother with her expenses. She started in August of 2000, when she was invited to sell cosmetics which seemed like a good idea to her as it would allow her to organize her time without neglecting the family. It was this how she started selling among her neighbors and friends, and later door-to-door. Currently, she counts on a diploma for high sales and is a candidate for Director.

She needs a loan of $925 USD, to be repaid in six months, to cover the necessary products for her customers and continue conserving them to increase her profits.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel B. sells clothing for both ladies and gentlemen near the Jubilee school in Cape Coast. Emmanuel has received a senior high education. He is not yet married and has no children.

Emmanuel has been selling clothing since 2002. He is responsible for paying his utility bills and other expenses. He will use his loan to buy more clothing to sell. He hopes to use the new profits to expand his business and increase his income so he can meet the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mamadou Moussa

texts.fr: Mr S. est un homme marié  pére de plusieurs enfants  il est agé  d'une trentaine d' années et fait du commerce de pieces de rechange  pour auto son principale activité génératrice de revenus.Il est installé à coté de la gare routiere et bénéficie d'une longue experience dans le domaine .le pret obtenu lui permettra de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. S. is a married man and a father of several children. He is in his 30's and trades in spare parts for motored vehicles. This is his principal income-generating work. He is settled in next to a bus station and benefits from lengthy experience in this domain. The loan obtained will enable him to bolster his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es: La Sra. Ileana  tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano, su negocio es la venta ropa, cosméticos, al contado y al crédito, con veintidós años en las ventas, ha carecido de capital para invertir más en su negocio, su esposo la ha apoyado siempre,  él trabaja  en una empresa privada como jefe de presupuestos. Sus hijos le ayudan con los quehaceres del hogar y actualmente están estudiando en la  universidad. Con la solicitud del préstamo quiere invertir en compra de ropa en los diferentes estilos, de adultos y de niños así como los productos de cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lleana is 41 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Monsenor Lezcano. She has had a business selling clothing and cosmetics for 22 years and has managed her money carefully to invest in her business. Her husband has always been supportive. He has a good job in a private company. Their children help with chores around the house and attend university. With the loan, Lleana would like to purchase different styles of clothing, for adults and children, as well as various cosmetics to offer to her customers.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different styles of clothing and various cosmetics to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim I. sells food items at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Ibrahim has received a Senior High level education. He is married and has two children. His wife is a trader. Ibrahim has been selling food since 1990. He is responsible for feeding the family and the paying the utility bills and the children's school fees. His loan will be used to buy food items for resale. He hopes to reinvest the profits in his business so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Amalia De Los Ángeles

texts.es: En  apoyo con  su esposo y   uno de sus hijos realiza  la actividad de lunes a domingo, inicio con un motor   moliendo masa de maíz.  Agradecida con un financiamiento de Adim logro comprarse otro motor con el que actualmente muele maíz tostado. Lo que le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas, ofrece además carnes molidas al por mayor y al detalle a pulperías del departamento. Muy segura de su negocio, sueña con tener una pulpería  y ofrecer variedad de productos, así como comidas rápidas y refrescos entre .otros ya que la ubicación de su casa se lo permite.
texts.en:
Supported by her husband and one of her sons, she conducts her activities from Monday to Sunday, having started with an electric mill grinding cornflour dough. Thanks to financing from ADIM, she managed to buy herself another mill which she uses to grind toasted corn. What has also helped her to increase her sales is that she additionally offers ground meats at wholesale, as well as to general stores in the area at retail. Very secure in her business, she dreams of having her own store where she can offer a variety of products such as fast foods and refreshments, among other items, given that the location of her house would allow her to do so.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Moussoukoro

texts.fr: Moussoukoro D. est membre a la caisse de liberte6 de l IMCEC/dakar sous le numero 705.Elle est couturiere .elle achete les tissus,les coud pour ensuite les vendre.Elle sollicite un pret pour renforcer son activite.
texts.en:
Moussoukoro D. is a member of the Liberte6 bank of the IMCEC/Dakar under the number 705. She is a seamstress. She buys fabrics for sewing and selling the items produced. She is requesting a loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jemiler

texts.en: Jemiler I. sells groceries like sugar, rice, biscuits, soap, and others items at the Siwdo compound near Cape Coast. Jemiler has received a Senior High school level education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a business man. Jemiler has been selling groceries since 2000. She is responsible for the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of groceries. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business so she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Petrona Del Socorro

texts.es: Su principal actividad  es una pulpería, donde ofrece variedad de productos de necesidad diaria. Con financiamientos  de Adim ofrece a sus clientes mercadería en general y cosméticos que antes no vendía, logrando así satisfacer necesidades y gustos que demanda la población. Tiene 15 años de experiencia en la actividad.  Su mayor deseo es contar siempre con financiamientos para inyectarle a su negocio. Y hacer un local más grande con mejor presentación. Vive con su hija quien  le apoya   con la atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
Petrona del Socorro has a small general store where she offers a variety of items for everyday use. With the financial help she's received, she has been able to offer her customers general merchandise as well as cosmetics which she wasn't able to sell before, therefore better meeting the demands of her customers. She has 15 years of experience running her business. Her hope is to be able to continue with these loans so that she can continue to invest in growing her business, one day having a much larger shop. She lives with her daughter, who helps her with the customers in the shop.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small general store and continue to grow the business

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Gracias a los financiamientos de ADIM  a podido darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos así como  la siembra del maíz,  lo  que luego   es utilizado para la elaboración  de rosquillas.  Su actividad la realiza en el mercado de Rivas tres veces por semana por las tardes. Doña Ana vive con su esposo y tres hijos quienes en conjunto combinan la actividad de   agricultura y  a la vez la elaboración y venta de las mismas, es reconocida por su actividad comercial. Plazo otorgado 4 meses.
texts.en:
Thanks to loan from ADIM she has been able to maintain her crops as well as sowing corn which is used to make doughnuts which she sells at the Rivas market three times a week in the afternoons. Doña Ana lives with her husband and three children who are all dedicated to farming and selling the products they make. Their comercial activity is well-known. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Asta Ngandy

texts.fr: madame gueye nee asta ngandy L. est membre a IMCEC/LIBERTE 6 sous le numero 536.Elle fait de la couture.elle achete des tissus,les coud pour ensuite les revendre.elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son activite.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gueye, née Asta Ngandy L., is member number 536 of IMCEC/LIBERTE 6. She is a seamstress. She buys fabric, sews things, and sells her articles. She is requesting this loan to increase her operating budget.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating budget

loans.name: Mirna Del Socorro

texts.es: Inicio su negocio ofreciendo sopas, gracias a un crédito, ofrecido  por  ADIM  logro  fortalecer su negocio ofreciendo cabeza de cerdo, morongas, comidas rápidas, indio viejo, refrescos entre otros. La actividad la realiza en su misma casa, trabaja de lunes a domingo. Doña Mirna vive con dos hijas quienes estudian y a la vez  cooperan con la preparación de los alimentos. Sueña con llegar a  tener una soda  con un local propio ofreciendo variedad de comidas.Plazo otorgado 4 meses.
texts.en:
Mirna started her business by making and selling soups. Thanks to a loan from ADIM, she was able to grow her business and now offers other food such as pork, sausages, snacks and cold drinks. She runs this business from her home, working Mondays through Sundays. Mirna lives with her two daughters who study at school, as well as help prepare the meals. Mirna's goal is to have her own location one day where she can offer a wide variety of food. She will repay the loan in 4 months.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her food business and one day open a larger location

loans.name: Miriam Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Miriam es madre soltera, su actividad principal es comideria., con el apoyo que ADIM le ha brindado ha mejorado la presentación de su local dándole un mejor vistazo a su negocio. Cuenta con el apoyo de su hija ha tenido 8 créditos con nuestra institución
Expresa agradecimiento  por los bienes y mejoras que ha podido obtener, sueña con tener un negocio más grande con mejores condiciones, logrando así incrementar sus ventas. Plazo otorgado 7 meses.
texts.en:
Miriam is a single mother whose primary activity is food production and sales. With the support that ADIM has provided her with, she has been able to improve her locale and make her business more attractive to customers. She counts on the support of her daughter, and has had 8 credits with our institution.

She expresses gratitude for the enhancements she has been able to obtain, and dreams of having a larger business with better conditions so she can manage to increase her sales. The term granted is seven months.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products.

loans.name: Lilliam Martina

texts.es:
La señora Lilliam Martina F. S., quien tiene la edad de 38 años, actualmente su estado civil es acompañada y con un pequeños hijo en edad escolar que tiene la obligación de mantener sus estudios. Se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 3 años en la ciudad de Masaya. Desde que inició el negocio ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y de mucho esfuerzo ya que cuando inició su negocio solamente contaba con 2 estantes de madera, y poco producto y ha logrado una superación personal y en su negocio, ya que el sueño de ella es darle una buena vida a su hijo. Una de las necesidades que atraviesa ella es la urgencia de obtener dinero para la compra de los productos de pulpería y es por esto que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan comprar sus productos como granos básicos: Arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles y cosméticos para comercializarlos, con el único fin de mantener su hogar y continuar dándole educación a sus hijos.

Es necesario destacar que desde que Ceprodel le brindó el crédito ha venido mejorando su situación económica ya que al incrementar los productos han incrementado sus ventas. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 1 créditos desde hace 3 meses.
texts.en:
Lilliam Martina F. S. is 38 years old. She lives with her partner and one young son who is school-aged and she is responsible for seeing to it that he can study. She has had a small grocery business for the past 3 years in the city of Masaya. Since beginning the business, she has shown herself to be a very responsible and hard-working person. When she began her business, she only had 2 wooden shelves and few products. She has achieved an improvements personally and in her business and her goal is to give a good life to her son. One of the needs she has is to obtain money to buy the products for her store. That is why she is applying to Ceprodel for a loan, which will allow her to buy products such as basic grains: Rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, and cosmetics she can sell. Her goal is to support her household and to continue providing an education for her children. It in necessary to emphasize that since Ceprodel gave her a loan she has been improving her economic situation. Increasing her products has increased her sales. Currently, her credit record is one loan three months ago.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes P. P., tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es acompañada, tiene un negocio que se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Ernesto Fernández, en el sector de la Plazoleta de las Huerteras, ahí vende verdura (tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, plátano y guineo), anteriormente la señora trabaja en el campo con su esposo ayudando a sacar la cosecha de pepino, pipianes y yuca, al ver su situación económica y siendo madre de dos hijos, se empezó a preocupar más ya que ellos están en el colegio y por ende busco como iniciar un negocio extra para ayudar a su compañero, se indagó en el mercado con unas amigas y adquirió un tramo y con un préstamo que pidió de C$ 2,000.00 inicio vendiendo legumbres, solo tenía las ganas de que le fuera bien, un canastro y una mesa, hoy en día cuenta con 5 canastos y cinco taburetes ahora cosecha y el producto que saca lo vende en el mercado de Masaya.

Es necesario destacar que desde que Ceprodel le ha brindado crédito ha venido mejorando su situación económica ya que al incrementar y diversificar los productos han incrementado sus ventas. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 2 créditos desde hace 2 años
texts.en:
Mercedes P. P. is 44 years old and lives with her husband. She has a business that is located in the Ernesto Fernandéz Market, in the Plazoleta de las Huertas neighborhood. She sells vegetables there (tomatoes, chiltoma, plantains, and bananas). She used to work in the fields with her husband, helping him to cultivate cucumbers, squash, and cassava. She looked at her economic situation, being the mother of two children, and began to worry more because they are in high school. Therefore, she looked for a way to start an extra business to help her husband. She looked into the market with some friends and acquired a spot there. With a loan of C$2,000.00 she began selling vegetables. She just wanted for things to go well, with one basket and one table. Today she has five baskets and five tables. Now she harvests and then sells her product in the market of Masaya. It is necessary to point out the since Ceprodel has extended her credit, she has been improving her economic situation. Since she increased and diversified her products, she has increased her sales. Currently, her credit record is 2 loans in the last 2 years.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Edith Del Socorro

texts.es:
Edith del Socorro B. se dedica desde hace cuatro años al negocio de venta de ropa especialmente para niños la cual la comercializa en su propio tramo en las cercanías al mercado de Masaya. Es una dama casada y con una pequeña hija la cual mantiene.

El motive por el cual hoy en día acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de mercadería como lo es la ropa para niños. Por esto es que ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y asi continuar con su negocio en su tramo en el departamento de Masaya.
texts.en:
Edith del Socorro B. has worked selling children’s clothing for the past four years. She sells the clothing from her own place on the outskirts of the Masaya market. She is a married woman and has a young daughter whom she supports.

The reason she has turned to Ceprodel is to get a loan to buy children’s clothing. For this, she hopes that the loan will be granted and that she will be able to continue her business from her space in the Masaya neighborhood.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Karla Del Carmen

texts.es:
La dama Karla A. es propietaria de una pulpería el cual atiende en la ciudad de Masaya brindando variedades de productos tales como comestibles, bebidas y productos personales.

Inició su negocio ofreciendo pocos productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha invertido en el negocio y  esto gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido salir adelante en su negocio y de esta forma mantener su humilde hogar de habitación. Actualmente se ha perfilado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel y espera que su crédito sea otorgado para la compra de la mercadería.
texts.en:
Karla Aragon is the owner of a small general store that she runs in the city of Masaya where she offers a variety of products like food, drinks, and personal hygiene products. She started her business offering very few products but as time has passed, she has invested in the store and thanks to help from Ceprodel, she has been able to grow her business which helps her cover the expenses of her humble home. She stands out as a faithful customer of Ceprodel and hopes to receive this loan in order to purchase additional merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general store products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase various products to replenish a small mini-market.
